TEXT:
George Clooney (56, "Hail, Caesar!") galt lange Zeit als begehrter Junggeselle, doch seit ein paar Monaten hat sich sein Ruf gewandelt. Neben der Schauspielerei ist er nach der Geburt der Zwillinge Ella und Alexander im Juni hauptsÃ¤chlich auch begeisterter Papa. Das FamilienglÃ¼ck fÃ¼r ihn und Ehefrau Amal Clooney (39) scheint perfekt. Doch manche der Aufgaben, die er als Neu-Papa erledigen muss, scheinen ihm nicht immer nur Freude zu bereiten...

Windeln wechseln? Igitt!

In Filmen spielt George Clooney selten VÃ¤ter: Hier kÃ¶nnen Sie sich "The American" ansehen

So offenbarte der Hollywood-Star beispielsweise vor kurzem im GesprÃ¤ch mit dem britischen "Mirror", dass es ihn derzeit vor allem davor grause, die Windeln seiner Kinder wechseln zu mÃ¼ssen. Denn seit die Zwillinge feste Nahrung zu sich nehmen dÃ¼rften, ist offenbar nicht mehr alles so sauber wie davor. "Vor drei Tagen haben meine Kinder mit dem, was wir feste Nahrung nennen, angefangen. Es geht rein als Karotte und es kommt raus, wie es eben raus kommt. Aber das war irgendwie schockierend. Wie es sich plÃ¶tzlich verÃ¤ndert hat. Es war wie ein Horrorfilm", scherzte Clooney Ã¼ber den neuen Windel-Inhalt seiner Babys.

Das rÃ¤t er anderen Eltern

Sein Rat an werdende VÃ¤ter lautete daher: "Gebt ihnen keine feste Nahrung. Bis sie ihre eigenen Windeln wechseln kÃ¶nnen, bekommen sie nur Milch."

Furz-GerÃ¤usche sind seine neue LieblingsbeschÃ¤ftigung

Doch abgesehen von diesem offenbar fÃ¼r ihn sehr verstÃ¶renden Erlebnis hat der 56-JÃ¤hrige wohl groÃŸen SpaÃŸ daran, Vater zu sein. "Sie sind jetzt in der Lage zu kichern und zu lachen und SpaÃŸ zu haben. Man bekommt etwas zurÃ¼ck", so George Clooney bei der Premiere seines neuen Films "Suburbicon". Um verrÃ¼ckte EinfÃ¤lle, um die Zwillinge bei Laune zu halten, ist er jedenfalls nicht verlegen: "Ich mache Furz-GerÃ¤usche und sie reagieren darauf. Es ist wunderbar!" Fragt sich nur, wer bei der ganzen Sache mehr SpaÃŸ hat...

Das macht ihm Angst

Im Interview mit Jimmy Kimmel (49) verriet er aber auch, dass er in manchen Situationen immer noch unsicher sei. "Ich habe Todesangst, es ist wirklich erschreckend", verriet er dem Moderator in dessen Late-Night-Show. "Man hat so Angst davor, ihnen etwas zu brechen. Sie sind so klein."

Doch die Liebe fÃ¼r seine beiden Kleinen scheint alles zu Ã¼bertreffen. Wie "E! News" berichtet, war sich Clooney bei der "Suburbicon"-After-Show-Party nicht zu schade, anderen GÃ¤sten stolz Fotos von den Zwillingen zu prÃ¤sentieren. "Irgendwann hat George mit einer Gruppe von Leuten Ã¼ber die Babys geredet. Dann hat er sein Smartphone aus der Tasche geholt und schnell ein Foto der Zwillinge gesucht und hergezeigt", berichtet ein Augenzeuge. "Als George das Foto gezeigt hat, hatte er das grÃ¶ÃŸte LÃ¤cheln im Gesicht, als wÃ¤re er wirklich stolz, seine Kinder herzeigen zu kÃ¶nnen. Er strahlte richtig."
TITLE: George Clooney erzÃ¤hlt Ã¼ber seine neue Aufgabe als Zwillingspapa

La riduzione inizierÃ  a gennaio 2018.
La linea della Bce Ã¨ quella di un programma di acquisti piÃ¹ basso, ma piÃ¹ lungo a livello temporale.
Un ragionamento che Draghi ha legato anche alla terminologia per definire la riduzione degli acquisti dei titoli: "Non credo che in Consiglio nessuna abbia proferito la parola tapering.
La Bce "continua ad aspettarsi che i tassi chiave resteranno agli attuali livelli per un prolungato periodo di tempo" e "ben oltre l'orizzonte della fine del programma di acquisti".
TEXT:
Il direttivo della Banca centrale europea ha deciso, a maggioranza, di dimezzare la portata del quantitative easing, il programma mensile di acquisti, dagli attuali 60 miliardi a 30 miliardi. La riduzione inizierÃ  a gennaio 2018. "La ricalibrazione degli acquisti riflette la crescente fiducia nella convergenza dell'inflazione verso i nostri livelli obiettivo, a sua volta sulla base del crescente rafforzarsi dell'espansione economica", ha spiegato il presidente dell'Eurotower, Mario Draghi.

Gli acquisti dei titoli saranno fortemente ridotti, ma la Bce potrÃ  tornare ad aumentare il Qe o allungare ulteriormente gli acquisti di titoli oltre settembre 2018 se dovesse essere necessario. "Se la prospettiva diventa meno favorevole o se le condizioni finanziarie non sono conformi agli ulteriori progressi verso un adeguamento sostenibile nel percorso dell'inflazione, il Consiglio direttivo Ã¨ pronto ad aumentare il programma di acquisto di asset in termini di dimensione e/o durata", si legge nel comunicato di Francoforte.

La precedente riduzione era stata decisa a dicembre del 2016, da 80 a 60 miliardi al mese, e la sua durata era stata prolungata fino a dicembre di quest'anno e "anche oltre se necessario".

La linea della Bce Ã¨ quella di un programma di acquisti piÃ¹ basso, ma piÃ¹ lungo a livello temporale. Se Ã¨ vero - Ã¨ il ragionamento dell'Eurotower - che la ripresa resta "solida", con possibili "sorprese" in positivo, Ã¨ altrettanto vero che l'inflazione di base Ã¨ sÃ¬ salita ma resta ancora lontana dal target fissato intorno al 2 per cento. Quindi, ha sottolineato Draghi, proprio per sostenere questi fattori positivi serve ancora "un ampio grado di politica monetaria accomodante".

La linea di un "livello elevato" di stimoli all'economia, rivendicata da Draghi, ha trovato conferma anche sull'assenza di un limite per l'espansione del bilancio della Bce proprio attraverso il quantitative easing. "No", ha risposto Draghi alla domanda di un giornalista che gli chiedeva se l'Eurotower si stia accingendo a fissare un limite di 2.500 miliardi, seguendo l'esempio della Fed che ha avviato una riduzione del proprio bilancio da 4.500 miliardi di dollari.

Un ragionamento che Draghi ha legato anche alla terminologia per definire la riduzione degli acquisti dei titoli: "Non credo che in Consiglio nessuna abbia proferito la parola tapering. Questo non Ã¨ un tapering ma una riduzione delle misure di stimolo". Tanto piÃ¹, ha sottolineato il presidente della Bce, che il programma resta open ended, cioÃ¨ gli acquisti non termineranno improvvisamente e quindi da settembre prossimo non ci sarÃ  una riduzione da 30 miliardi di euro al mese a zero.

I tassi restano al minimo storico (e lo saranno ancora a lungo)

L'Eurotower ha lasciato i tassi di interesse invariati al minimo storico. Il tasso principale Ã¨ allo 0%, quello sui depositi resta negativo allo -0,4%, mentre il tasso sui prestiti marginali Ã¨ a 0,25 per cento. La Bce "continua ad aspettarsi che i tassi chiave resteranno agli attuali livelli per un prolungato periodo di tempo" e "ben oltre l'orizzonte della fine del programma di acquisti".

Le Borse europee accelerano dopo la decisione della Bce

Londra segna un rialzo dello 0,50% a 7.484 punti, Francoforte dello 0,59% a 13.029, Parigi dello 0,84% a 5.420 e Milano dell'1,15% a 22.709.
TITLE: Bazooka dimezzato

Non pas que les choses ne se dÃ©roulent pas bien actuellement pour les vins de cette catÃ©gorie. Bien au contraire, puisque ceux-ci poursuivent leur croissance. Jugez-en par vous-mÃªmes.

Quelques chiffres

Voici quelques statistiques comparatives pour une pÃ©riode donnÃ©e de douze mois comprise entre la fin de 2016 et le dÃ©but de 2017:

Nombre de bouteilles vendues: + 4%

Valeur des bouteilles vendues: + 11%

Alors que le rÃ©pertoire de la SAQ compte environ 8,800 vins, celui des vins en importation privÃ©e frÃ´le maintenant les 17,000 rÃ©fÃ©rences.

Bien sÃ»r, la plupart de ces produits ne sont disponibles bien souvent qu'en petites quantitÃ©s. Mais le chiffre d'affaires total reprÃ©sente tout de mÃªme pour la SAQ 135 millions de dollars, ce montant dÃ©coulant de la vente de plus de 7,3 millions de bouteilles.

Plus uniquement que des restaurateurs

Plusieurs chroniqueurs ont par le passÃ© dÃ©mystifiÃ© auprÃ¨s de leurs lecteurs le fonctionnement du systÃ¨me de l'importation privÃ©e.

Je le faisais dÃ©jÃ  pour ma part dÃ¨s 2013 (Pourquoi vous priver des vins d'importation privÃ©e), ainsi qu'en 2014 (voir ici) RÃ©sultat? Alors qu'Ã  l'Ã©poque presque tous les achats Ã©taient faits par des restaurateurs, la part de ces derniers est maintenant passÃ©e Ã  75%, le reste, soit 25%, Ã©tant maintenant le lot des consommateurs comme vous et moi. Tout un revirement.

La clÃ© de la croissance

La croissance Ã  long terme pour les vins d'importation privÃ©e semble devoir donc passer par les consommateurs, ceux-ci Ã©tant beaucoup plus nombreux que les restaurateurs. La tendance le confirme. Mais encore faut-il savoir comment les trouver.

Il y a toujours le RASPIPAV (Regroupement des Agences SpÃ©cialisÃ©es dans la Promotion des Importations PrivÃ©es des Alcools et des Vins).

Le moteur de recherches de leur site internet permet Ã  l'amateur curieux d'identifier des produits d'importation privÃ©e selon leur nature et leur producteur, ainsi que les coordonnÃ©es de l'agence qui les reprÃ©sente. C'est par contre uniquement en communiquant avec celles-ci que l'on pourra confirmer leur disponibilitÃ© ainsi que leur prix.

Il y a aussi la SociÃ©tÃ© des alcools du QuÃ©bec comme source d'information. Disons que quelqu'un dÃ©couvre un vin d'importation privÃ©e lors d'une sortie au restaurant. L'ayant aimÃ©, il prend le nom du vin et du producteur en note. Il peut alors appeler au Centre de Relation ClientÃ¨le (514. 254-2020 ou le 1-866-873-2020) pour obtenir les dÃ©tails Ã  son sujet.

Pour une meilleure visibilitÃ© Pour une meilleure visibilitÃ©

Mais le truc infaillible pour les repÃ©rer rapidement serait que la SAQ qui dÃ©tient toutes les informations Ã  propos des vins d'importation privÃ©e (noms des produits et des producteurs, millÃ©simes, prix, etc.) puisque c'est elle qui les garde dans son entrepÃ´t, les affiche sur son site internet avec les coordonnÃ©es de l'agence Ã  contacter. Juste Ã§a, ce serait dÃ©jÃ  plus que bien.

Et que dire si on pouvait les acheter Ã  l'unitÃ© et non Ã  la caisse comme prÃ©sentement!

Et que dire si on pouvait les acheter Ã  l'unitÃ© et non Ã  la caisse comme prÃ©sentement! Je suis loin de fabuler croyez-moi.

Il y a exactement un an, le PDG de la SAQ, M. Alain Brunet, accordait une entrevue Ã  FrÃ©dÃ©ric Arnould (Baisse des prix et accÃ¨s simplifiÃ© aux vins d'importation privÃ©e)dans laquelle celui-ci dÃ©clarait que nous verrions ceci d'ici deux ans.

Un an plus tard, la promesse de la baisse des prix est en cours de rÃ©alisation. Bravo. Quant Ã  la partie concernant les vins d'importation privÃ©e, nous nous en reparlerons l'annÃ©e prochaine en espÃ©rant que les choses auront bougÃ© de ce cÃ´tÃ©.

Mon collÃ¨gue FrÃ©dÃ©ric Arnould, dans un billet publiÃ© trÃ¨s rÃ©cemment (L'importation privÃ©e sur saq.com: pas demain la veille...) semblait pour sa part plutÃ´t pessimiste Ã  cet Ã©gard.

Note: Je remercie AndrÃ© Papineau, coprÃ©sident du Raspipav et Renaud Dugas, Responsable des relations de presse de la SAQ, pour avoir acceptÃ© de rÃ©pondre Ã  mes questions sur l'objet de cet article.

Les avantages

En plus de pouvoir enfin repÃ©rer les milliers de produits en importation privÃ©e rÃ©fÃ©rencÃ©s par les agences, ce qui ne pourrait que faire mousser les ventes, le public pourrait avoir un accÃ¨s immÃ©diat aux prix de vente de ceux-ci.

Car c'est un secret de polichinelle dans l'industrie du vin, que certains restaurateurs (heureusement minoritaires) mettent sur leur carte des vins d'importation privÃ©e, principalement parce que leurs clients ne peuvent connaÃ®tre leur prix de vente au dÃ©tail, comme c'est le cas pour les vins vendus dans les succursales de la SAQ.

19568023 - couple ordering dinner in a restaurant

Si vous savez que tel vin se vend 15$ Ã  la SAQ, vous rechignerez sans doute Ã  le payer 60$ au restaurant, mais pas si vous l'ignorez! On comprend que les restaurateurs pour survivre doivent se prendre une marge de profit raisonnable sur les vins (multiple variant entre 2 et 2,5 habituellement, parfois 3).

Mais quand le multiple passe de 4 Ã  5 fois le prix coÃ»tant, on ne peut s'empÃªcher de penser qu'il y aurait peut-Ãªtre lÃ  exagÃ©ration. Bien sÃ»r, s'il s'agit d'un restaurant haut de gamme au service trÃ¨s attentionnÃ©, cela peut Ãªtre diffÃ©rent, car leur clientÃ¨le le comprendra et l'acceptera.

Ce n'est malheureusement pas toujours le cas. Mais je le rÃ©pÃ¨te, ce ne sont pas tous les restaurateurs qui abusent Ã  ce chapitre. Ceux qui se prennent une marge dÃ©cente de profit ne s'opposeront donc pas Ã  ce que les consommateurs puissent enfin connaÃ®tre le prix de dÃ©tail des vins d'importation privÃ©e.

Que faire en attendant?

Le meilleur moyen prÃ©sentement de dÃ©couvrir les vins en importation privÃ©e, c'est d'assister au 10e salon du Raspipav qui se tiendra trÃ¨s bientÃ´t Ã  MontrÃ©al et Ã  QuÃ©bec.

C'est une belle et rare opportunitÃ© de pouvoir goÃ»ter Ã  plus de 2000 produits non disponibles dans les succursales de la SAQ et de rencontrer prÃ¨s de 150 vignerons.

Profitez de l'Ã©vÃ¨nement pour acheter vos bouteilles Â« coups de cÅ“ur Â» Ã  l'unitÃ© directement sur place en cherchant les pastilles bleues Ã  chacun des kiosques. Payez aux bornes de paiement de la SAQ avant de quitter les lieux, et recevez votre commande dans le confort de votre foyer ou dans une succursale SAQ prÃ¨s de chez vous, et ce, avant le 1er dÃ©cembre. Cela ne serait-il pas merveilleux si c'Ã©tait comme cela Ã  l'annÃ©e?

Vous trouverez ici les informations Ã  propos de cet Ã©vÃ¨nement et pourrez aussi acheter Ã  l'avance vos billets.

Bonnes dÃ©couvertes!

Suggestions de vins pour cette semaine:

Cette semaine, je vous recommande 5 vins (2 vins blancs et 3 rouges), de France, d'Italie, du Portugal et de l'Ã©tat de Washington, offerts entre 8,05$ et 19,55$.

TEXT:
Have you ever been presented with the opportunity to cuddle a tiger cub or baby sloth? Who wouldn't want a photo with these adorable animals? Well I'm urging you to resist the next temptation because there is a lifetime of cruelty behind that seemingly picture-perfect moment.

Sloths are taken from the wild and used for harmful selfies with tourists, in Manaus, Brazil

A new investigation by World Animal Protection uncovered the alarming trend of wildlife selfies and the cruelty that happens behind the scenes. The rise in mobile phones and social media has resulted in a serious animal welfare and conservation problem. And it is happening all around the world, even far deep in the Amazon rainforest, a place where you would think wildlife are most protected.

In the heart of the Amazon jungle, wild animals such as sloths, dolphins, snakes and monkeys are being plucked from their habitat â€” often illegally â€” to be handed over to tourists for selfies. Our investigators found baby sloths that had been snatched from their mothers to be kept as a tourist lure and photo prop. The mothers are often killed in the process and when the tourists have gone home, the baby sloths are kept in small, barren cages. They found caimans kept in broken refrigerators with their jaws restrained by rubber bands to try to make selfies safer for tourists. But it is far from safe for the animals involved. Some animals were beaten into submission while others showed physical scars from rough handling.

Many of these animals won't be released back into the wild and their chances of survival are slim if they are. Sloths won't likely survive more than six months when used for selfie tourism. Their low metabolism, slow movement and restricted diet make them particularly difficult to keep humanely in captivity and rehabilitate for release back into the wild.

A three-toed sloth named "Lucky" at AIUNAU sanctuary in Colombia.

The well-intentioned eco-tourist is not likely aware of the suffering they are causing before they snap their photo. Unfortunately for sloths, they look like they are smiling even when they are suffering and they're slow to react to stress and pain stimuli. But make no mistake, they're scared when handled by tourists all day and suffer when denied every opportunity to behave naturally. In the wild, they spend the majority of their lives in the tree canopy but our investigators found sloths living on the ground, tied to trees.

Sloth clinging to cage.

Here in Canada, many zoos offer visitors the opportunity to hold a wild animal for a selfie and will lend their animals out for photo props at events as Justin Bieber famously highlighted when he posed with a lion cub and a tiger at a party in Toronto in the spring of 2016. An undercover video released by Animal Justice last August shows the appalling cruel treatment of animals at a zoo near Ottawa which allows people to take wildlife selfies.

Thankfully, Toronto just voted to ban mobile zoos from bringing exotic animals like kangaroos and large snakes to events in the city but many types of wild animals are still permitted at birthday parties and community events in the city and across the country. Whether the animal is a turtle, stingray, snake or lion cub, handling wildlife comes at a high cost to the animal's welfare and sends the public the wrong message â€” a message that runs contrary to the one our park rangers and wildlife conservation officers are trying to spread.

Parks Canada staff say an increasing number of tourists are getting dangerously close to bears and other wild animals all for the sake of a photo. People have been maimed taking selfies with bison in Yellowstone National Park. People around the world were outraged upon learning that three dolphins died for selfies in separate incidents over the course of 18 months after being plucked out of the ocean and passed around a beach in Argentina and Spain. When will this nonsense stop before more people and animals are harmed?

It starts with all of us. If you can hug or hold a wild animal, it is cruel, so please don't do it. By not engaging in wildlife selfies, you will help end the profitability of this industry and keep wild animals where they belong: in the wild. Now of course if an animal photobombs you, go ahead and promote your picture! If the animal is domesticated, chooses to be in your picture and has every opportunity to behave naturally, it's likely a humane photo. The best way to experience wildlife is in the wild and from a respectful distance. For tips on how to protect animals while travelling and to take World Animal Protection's Wildlife Selfie Code, please visit www.worldanimalprotection.ca

TITLE: Resist The Temptation To Take A Cruel Wildlife Selfie

Der Polizist William Felt fÃ¤hrt durch Ashtabula, Ohio. In den USA hat eine beispiellose Drogenepidemie ganze Landstriche fest in ihrem Griff. | dpa

In den USA hat eine beispiellose Drogenepidemie ganze Landstriche fest im Griff

PrÃ¤sident Trump hat deswegen den nationalen Notstand ausrufen

In einer kleinen Stadt in Ohio kÃ¤mpft ein Polizist an vorderster Front gegen die Krise

Der Dealer fÃ¤hrt einen Mietwagen, er hat ihn sofort erkannt. "Von frÃ¼heren Festnahmen", sagt William Felt, wÃ¤hrend er seinen Wagen langsam Ã¼ber die holprige StraÃŸe steuert. DrauÃŸen dÃ¤mmert es, die Luft ist noch warm, es war ein ungewÃ¶hnlich heiÃŸer Oktobertag in Ashtabula im Nordosten Ohios.

Der Polizist fÃ¤hrt vorbei an eingezÃ¤unten Wohnanlagen und verrosteten SpielgerÃ¤ten. Er passiert ein Pflegeheim, das leer steht, seit darin ein Methlabor in die Luft flog und das Haus in Brand setzte. "Methamphetamin war ein groÃŸes Problem hier", sagt er. "Aber innerhalb von sechs Monaten hatte jeder in der Drogen-Community nur noch Heroin. Das war so etwa Ende 2015. Jeder hatte Heroin."

Trump hat den nationalen Notstand erklÃ¤rt

Felt kÃ¤mpft an vorderster Front gegen eine der schlimmsten Opioid-Krisen, die die USA je gesehen haben. Zur Gruppe der Opioide zÃ¤hlen neben Heroin auch Mittel, die als Medikamente eingesetzt werden. PrÃ¤sident Donald Trump hat wegen der dramatischen AusmaÃŸe sogar den nationalen Notstand erklÃ¤rt.

Der Polizist gehÃ¶rt zu einer Sonderheit, die sich in Ashtabula County um DrogenkriminalitÃ¤t kÃ¼mmert, einem Bezirk am Eriesee mit knapp 99.000 Menschen. Fast tÃ¤glich haben der 46-JÃ¤hrige und seine Kollegen es mit einer HeroinÃ¼berdosis zu tun. 270 waren es in diesem Jahr schon, 29 davon endeten tÃ¶dlich. In anderen Gegenden sind es noch mehr.



Eine Tankstelle in Ohio, die nach Angaben der Polizei von Drogendealern genutzt wird, um Heroin zu verkaufen.

Seit 18 Jahren ist er Polizist, vorher war er in der Armee, wÃ¤hrend der Achtziger war er in Deutschland stationiert. Der 46-JÃ¤hrige hat die Haare zu einem BÃ¼rstenschnitt geschoren, den linken Arm ziert ein Drachentattoo. Er neigt nicht zu Ãœbertreibungen, er wÃ¤hlt seine Worte mit Bedacht. Aber das, was gerade in Ashtabula passiert, frustriert ihn sichtlich.

Fast immer hat es mit Heroin zu tun

Felt fÃ¤hrt durch die StraÃŸen der 18 000-Einwohner-Stadt, er zeigt auf WohnhÃ¤user und GeschÃ¤fte, er spricht Ã¼ber Durchsuchungen und Tote und fast immer hat es mit Heroin zu tun.

Die Tankstelle, in der Dealer auf Kunden warten. Der McDonalds gegenÃ¼ber, auf dessen Parkplatz sich die AbhÃ¤ngigen zurÃ¼ckziehen, um sich die Droge sofort zu spritzen. Die BÃ¼cherei, vor der abends nun immer eine Streife parkt, weil es dort zu so vielen Ãœberdosen kam. Das Apartment, in der sie eine Frau fanden, die schon einen Tag tot war. Ihr Baby lag im Bett.

Manchmal, wenn Felt und seine Kollegen HÃ¤user durchsuchen, kÃ¶nnen sie sich kaum bewegen, so vermÃ¼llt ist es. Er erzÃ¤hlt von zwei Kindern, sechs und elf Jahre alt, die mit im Haus waren, als der Vater Heroin verkaufte. "Wir haben bei ihnen einen Drogentest machen lassen, um auszuschlieÃŸen, dass sie nicht unwissentlich Heroin genommen haben."



Jedes Mal, wenn wieder jemand irgendwo gefunden wurde, bekommt Felt eine Textnachricht auf sein Handy. Wenn Tote darunter sind, fÃ¤hrt er selbst raus.

Todeszahlen sind 40 Mal hÃ¶her als in Deutschland

Es ist das hÃ¤ssliche Gesicht einer Epidemie, die von New Hampshire Ã¼ber Ohio bis nach Kentucky ganze Landstriche fest in ihrem Griff hat und jeden Tag im Schnitt 91 Opfer fordert. Im Jahr 2015 starben nach Angaben der GesundheitsbehÃ¶rde CDC rund 52.000 Menschen an einer Ãœberdosis Drogen.

Rund 33.000 von ihnen hatten Opioide eingenommen, bei knapp 13.000 von ihnen war es Heroin. Zum Vergleich: In Deutschland gab es 2015 insgesamt 1226 Drogentote. In den USA leben zwar fast viermal so viele Menschen wie in Deutschland, die Todeszahlen sind in den Vereinigten Staaten aber mehr als 40 Mal so hoch.

Die Krise kennt keine sozialen Grenzen, kein Alter, keine Postleitzahlen. Die, die gegen sie ankÃ¤mpfen, sagen, dass so ziemlich alle Teile der Gesellschaft betroffen sind. SchÃ¤tzungen zufolge sind in den USA zwei Millionen Menschen abhÃ¤ngig von Opioiden.

â–º Besonders schlimm ist es in strukturschwachen Regionen im Rust Belt oder den Apalachen. Arme Gegenden, die fÃ¼r den Abstieg der Mittelschicht stehen. Gegenden, in denen Donald Trump viele AnhÃ¤nger fand.

Eine Dosis Heroin gibt es fÃ¼r 10 oder 20 Dollar

Es ist eine Katastrophe in drei Akten. Erst waren es die Schmerzmittel wie Oxycodon oder Hydrocodon, dann kam das Heroin, seit einiger Zeit sind es starke synthetische Mittel wie Fentanyl oder Carfentanyl, die fÃ¼r etliche TodesfÃ¤lle verantwortlich sind.

Viele der AbhÃ¤ngigen sind Ã¼ber Oxycodon oder andere verschreibungspflichtige Medikamente in die Sucht gerutscht. Die Mittel sind vom chemischen Aufbau her eng mit Heroin verwandt.

Seit den Neunzigern wurden sie in den USA sehr freizÃ¼gig verschrieben. Nicht nur nach schweren Operationen, sondern zum Beispiel schon bei Knieschmerzen. Studien hatten Hinweise geliefert, dass die Suchtgefahr gar nicht so groÃŸ sei. Das ist inzwischen widerlegt.

Eine der vielen traurigen Seltsamkeiten dieser Geschichte ist, dass viele SÃ¼chtige auf Heroin umgestiegen sind, weil es schlicht oft der billigere Weg in die selig dumpfe Wattewelt des Opioid-Rausches ist. WÃ¤hrend eine einzelne Oxy-Pille auf dem Schwarzmarkt schon mal 50 Dollar kosten kann, gibt es die Dosis Heroin schon fÃ¼r 10 oder 20 Dollar.



Der Polizist William Felt sitzt in seinem BÃ¼ro an seinem Schreibtisch.

Nalaxon kann innerhalb von Sekunden Leben retten

In manchen Gegenden ist es so schlimm, dass die BehÃ¶rden ungewÃ¶hnliche Wege beschreiten. Wie in Canton in Ohio, wo der Ã¶rtliche Gerichtsmediziner im MÃ¤rz einen KÃ¼hltransporter anmieten musste. Es hatte zu viele Tote auf einmal gegeben, die HÃ¤lfte von ihnen war an einer Ãœberdosis gestorben.

â–º Oder die BÃ¼cherei in Philadelphia, wo die Bibliothekare darin geschult werden, wie sie einem Bewusstlosen das Gegenmittel Naloxon verabreichen.

Bei einer Opioid-Ãœberdosis verlangsamt sich der Atem so sehr, dass nicht mehr genÃ¼gend Sauerstoff ins Gehirn kommt. Es kann zum Atemstillstand kommen. Naloxon, das in den USA weitlÃ¤ufig unter seinem Markennamen Narcan bekannt ist, blockiert die entsprechenden Rezeptoren im Gehirn, so dass die Wirkung des Opioids aussetzt.

Innerhalb von Sekunden kann das Mittel Leben retten, aber es ist umstritten. Manche Sheriffs wollen nicht, dass ihre Leute es bei sich tragen. Weil sie finden, dass das nicht die Aufgabe der Polizisten sei. Oder weil sie um ihre Sicherheit fÃ¼rchten.



Naloxon, das weitlÃ¤ufig unter seinem Markennamen "Narcan" bekannt ist, blockiert bei einer Opioid-Ãœberdosis die entsprechenden Rezeptoren im Gehirn und kann innerhalb von Sekunden Leben retten.

William Felt hat immer eine Dosis Narcan in seiner Tasche. Einmal, im April oder Mai, habe er einer Frau auf dem Parkplatz der BÃ¼cherei so das Leben gerettet, erzÃ¤hlt er. Sie lag auf dem RÃ¼cksitz ihres Autos, die TÃ¼ren standen offen. Am helllichten Tage, das kommt Ã¶fter vor, gehÃ¶rt in StÃ¤dten wie Ashtabula inzwischen zum Alltag.

"Wir finden sie in HÃ¶fen, in Autos, in Restaurants. Meistens Ã¼berdosieren die Menschen in Toiletten, sei es bei jemandem Zuhause oder in einem Ã¶ffentlichen GebÃ¤ude", sagt der Polizist. Ãœberall dort, wo es kostenloses WLAN gibt, sei es besonders schlimm. Weil die SÃ¼chtigen von dort ihre Dealer anrufen kÃ¶nnten, ohne Telefonkosten zu haben.

An einem Tag Ende September hatten sie in Ashtabula County 16 Ãœberdosis-FÃ¤lle, am nÃ¤chsten Tag noch einmal zwei. Dann nahmen sie eine Dealerin hoch, sie hatte mit Fentanyl gemischtes Heroin verkauft.

Das synthetische Opioid ist etwa hundert Mal so stark wie Morphin, deshalb ist die Gefahr einer Ãœberdosierung so viel grÃ¶ÃŸer. Es wird als Schmerzmittel etwa fÃ¼r Krebspatienten und bei Narkosen verwendet, findet sich auf Schmerzpflastern.

Aber die vielen MissbrauchsfÃ¤lle haben mit illegal hergestelltem Fentanyl zu tun, das aus China oder Mexiko in die USA kommt, oft Ã¼ber den Postweg.



Ashtabula in Ohio. Die Stadt kÃ¤mpft mit zahlreichen FÃ¤llen von Drogentoden.

Mindestens 236 Ãœberdosis-FÃ¤lle wegen Carfentanyl

Noch grÃ¶ÃŸeres Kopfzerbrechen bereitet den SicherheitsbehÃ¶rden seit einiger Zeit Caryfentanyl, ein Mittel, das ursprÃ¼nglich entwickelt wurde, um Elefanten und andere groÃŸe Tiere zu betÃ¤uben. Es ist noch einmal 100 Mal stÃ¤rker als Fentanyl. Schon eine winzige Menge kann tÃ¶dlich sein. Schon die BerÃ¼hrung ist gefÃ¤hrlich.

In Akron, das eineinhalb Autostunden sÃ¼dwestlich von Ashtabula liegt, kÃ¶nnen sie sich noch genau daran erinnern, wann sie die ersten FÃ¤lle mit Carfentanyl hatten. Rund um den 4. Juli 2016 sei das gewesen, dem UnabhÃ¤ngigkeitstag, sagt Gerald Craig.

PlÃ¶tzlich sei die Zahl der Ãœberdosis-FÃ¤lle rasant gestiegen. Craig ist GeschÃ¤ftsfÃ¼hrer des ADM Board, einer Organisation, die Therapieeinrichtungen unterstÃ¼tzt.

Zwischen dem 5. und dem 26. Juli zÃ¤hlten RettungskrÃ¤fte in Akron mindestens 236 Ãœberdosis-FÃ¤lle, die mit Carfentanyl zu tun hatten. Davon waren 14 tÃ¶dlich. Zum Vergleich: In den ersten sechs Monaten des Jahres hatten sie insgesamt 320 FÃ¤lle.

Im SÃ¼den der rund 197.000 Einwohner zÃ¤hlenden Stadt liegt eine Strafanstalt fÃ¼r Frauen, die auf AbhÃ¤ngige spezialisiert ist. Sie sollen hier lernen, wieder ins Leben zu finden. Sich um ihre Kinder zu kÃ¼mmern, eine Wohnung zu finden, von den Drogen wegzukommen.

Nicht immer klappt das, es gibt RÃ¼ckfÃ¤lle, manche Frauen kommen ein zweites Mal her. "Man denkt dann schon, dass es natÃ¼rlich scheiÃŸe ist, dass sie wieder da sind", sagt Jennifer Cross, die Leiterin des Programms. "Aber ich denke dann auch oft, Gott sei dank, hier drinnen in unserer Obhut sind sie wenigstens sicher."



Reba McCray, ehemalige HeroinabhÃ¤ngige und jetzige Leiterin einer Therapieeinrichtung.

Neue Richtlinien zur Verschreibung von opioidhaltigen Medikamenten

Reba McCray hat die Sucht hinter sich gelassen. Fast ihr ganzes Leben lang sei sie von Opioiden abhÃ¤ngig gewesen, zuletzt von Heroin, erzÃ¤hlt die 54-JÃ¤hrige aus Akron. Seit neun Jahren ist sie runter davon, seit dem 24. September 2008. Das Datum weiÃŸ sie auswendig.

â–º McCray ist inzwischen Direktorin der Therapieeinrichtung, die ihr einst selbst half. Aber wenn sie von sich selbst spricht, dann sagt sie, sie sei immer noch "in recovery", im Prozess der Heilung.

Als sie vor einiger Zeit operiert worden sei, habe ihr der Arzt Schmerzmittel verschrieben. "Ich habe die Tabletten drei Tage lang genommen. Am dritten Tag habe ich nach drei Stunden gedacht: Kann ich die nÃ¤chste nehmen? Danach habe ich sie weggeschmissen. Es hat mich ein bisschen verrÃ¼ckt gemacht."

Der Bundesstaat Ohio hat vor kurzem neue Richtlinien zur Verschreibung von opioidhaltigen Medikamenten erlassen. Bei akuten Schmerzen dÃ¼rfen diese nun nicht lÃ¤nger als sieben Tage verschrieben werden. Das sei ein richtiger Schritt, er komme aber zu spÃ¤t, sagen manche Beobachter.



Ein Motel in Ashtabula, in dem nach Angaben der Polizei oft DrogengeschÃ¤fte getÃ¤tigt werden.

Und so kÃ¤mpfen Menschen wie William Felt weiter gegen die Krise. In Ashtabula ist es inzwischen Abend geworden. Der Polizist passiert ein heruntergekommenes Motel. Das GebÃ¤ude wirkt verwaist, an einem Pfosten lehnt ein Fahrrad. "Das ist wahrscheinlich von einem DrogenkÃ¤ufer."

Er fÃ¤hrt an einer Autowaschanlage vorbei, im Eingang parken zwei Wagen. "Ein Drogen-Deal. Die sind nicht hier, um ihre Autos zu waschen."

Felt fÃ¤hrt nach Hause. Sein Handy bleibt stumm. Ein Tag ohne Ãœberdosis.

SUMMARY:
Think of Humpty Dumpty and you no doubt picture an egg on a wall -- or, if you're the morbid type, an egg smashed to pieces at the bottom of one.
Humpty Dumpty sat on a wall (a refresher) Humpty Dumpty sat on a wall, Humpty Dumpty had a great fall; All the king's horses and all the king's men Couldn't put Humpty together again.
Chapter six of the book is entitled 'Humpty Dumpty' and apparently, it's here that Humpty first appeared as an egg.
But while Carroll may have introduced Humpty as an egg, he can't be credited with the original nursery rhyme.
According to several war historians, the original Humpty Dumpty was not an egg, not a chicken, not a man but a CANNON.
TEXT:
Think of Humpty Dumpty and you no doubt picture an egg on a wall -- or, if you're the morbid type, an egg smashed to pieces at the bottom of one.

That's because Humpty has been depicted as an egg for hundreds of years, despite the fact the actual rhyme never refers to him as one.

Humpty Dumpty sat on a wall (a refresher) Humpty Dumpty sat on a wall, Humpty Dumpty had a great fall; All the king's horses and all the king's men Couldn't put Humpty together again. Source: The Dorling Kindersley Book of Nursery Rhymes

See? It's no eggsageration. It's no yolk. It's enough to make you go into shell shock. (OK we'll stop.)

But seriously. How the flip (sorry) did Humpty end up as an egg?

Well, apparently it's all thanks to Lewis Carroll (yes, he of 'Alice in Wonderland' fame) and his 1872 novel 'Through the Looking-Glass'.

Chapter six of the book is entitled 'Humpty Dumpty' and apparently, it's here that Humpty first appeared as an egg.

"However, the egg only got larger and larger, and more and more human: when she had come within a few yards of it, she saw that it had eyes and a nose and mouth; and when she had come close to it, she saw clearly that it was Humpty Dumpty himself. 'It can't be anybody else!' she said to herself. 'I'm as certain of it, as if his name were written all over his face.'" - Extract from 'Through the Looking Glass', Lewis Carroll.

Much like an omelette in a stainless steel pan, this portrayal of Humpty apparently stuck (sorry again) and he's been an egg ever since.

But while Carroll may have introduced Humpty as an egg, he can't be credited with the original nursery rhyme. So what was Humpty before he was an egg? (Hopefully a chicken, because that would settle a really long debate.)

Pinterest

The original depiction of Humpty as an egg, illustrated by John Tenniel.

Nope. According to several war historians, the original Humpty Dumpty was not an egg, not a chicken, not a man but a CANNON.

Yep. A large cannon which is believed to have been used in English Civil War (1642-1649), specifically, in the 1648 Siege of Colchester.

The rhyme came about because as Colchester was under siege, one of the cannons from the attacking side managed to destroy the wall 'Humpty Dumpty' was positioned on. Hence, Humpty Dumpty came tumbling down.

Due to its massive size, none of the king's horses and none of the king's men were able to put it back together again... and so Humpty's legacy was born.

So there you have it. Once a cannon, now an egg, forever a popular nursery rhyme.

You're welcome.
TITLE: Why Is Humpty Dumpty An Egg? An Investigation

SUMMARY:
A group of young men meet to discuss gender rights in Guatemala.
In this journey, men are equal partners of change with equal responsibility for change.
We've seen young men living in some of the most chauvinistic cultures begin to question their identities and champion gender equality.
We must bring down the system that insidiously and persistently whispers and sometimes screams that women and girls are not equal to men.
So now that we've said #MeToo, let's shout #WeMust so loudly that the glass ceiling shatters and the system breaks.
TEXT:
Young campaigners in Malawi pushed the government to amend the constitution of their country to end child marriage.

Last week, the hashtag #MeToo erupted online. Millions of women shared their stories of abuse, harassment, assault, and degradation. It was an incendiary moment. The sheer volume of testimonials demonstrated to the world that while Harvey Weinstein's decades-long reign of terror may have been the spark that ignited the blaze, there has long existed a dense forest of abuse... ready to be set afire.

Sexual harassment and assault is not an issue restricted solely to Hollywood. It is a global problem. The ugly reality is that it is happening in every industry, every culture and every corner on earth. Wherever there are unequal power relations between men and women, assault and harassment are endemic. But now that we have both sustained media interest and high-profile survivors offering up their personal experiences and traumas we are left asking, now what?

The only thing more heartbreaking than reading this litany of abuses is the fear that even after such a polarizing moment, nothing will change.

An adolescent girl in Nicaragua now lives in a shelter for girls who have suffered violence or sexual abuse.

We cannot let that happen.

We owe it, not only to all those who spoke up, but for the countless women and girls and other survivors whose stories have not been told, and who are still afraid and at risk. Globally, survivors have been sounding the alarm bell for decades, the challenge has been society has been unwilling or unable to hear it. The Weinstein story has made us aware that in Hollywood, whispered rumours and warnings led to women banding together to try and find their own protective measures. This is no doubt true the world over as well.

But this is not enough.

We must leverage this polarizing moment to do better. We owe that to our future generations, to the children and girls of today.

Here is how we ensure these sacrifices were not made in vain: we stop speaking only to women and girls. We stop treating this issue as a women's issue â€” it is a human rights issue. This abuse isn't being inflicted by some nebulous groups of villains. For every woman who is harassed or attacked, there is predator who has acted.

We must bring boys and men into the conversation, and not simply as allies. Men and boys must be more than that. They must be battling endemic sexism and gender-based violence right alongside women and girls, not benevolent observers cheering from the sidelines. They must have their own stake in the struggle, and not just because they have sisters or a mother.

A group of young men meet to discuss gender rights in Guatemala.

Thankfully, we are starting to see this thinking gain momentum as men have begun tweeting #HowIWillChange in the wake of the #MeToo revelations, shifting the onus on men to share, reflect and reform. But, this move away from ally-ship to collective humanism has to occur at every level of society, and requires bravery and resilience.

I know this is the key to unlocking transformative change because this is the work that Plan International Canada engages in alongside communities around the world. Together we strive to uproot the systemic inequities that prevent gender equality from flourishing, emphasizing that we each have a role to play in abolishing harmful stereotypes and norms.

In this journey, men are equal partners of change with equal responsibility for change. Importantly, they are also equal beneficiaries of change, as they are too often locked in rigid feedback loops of toxic masculinities and violence.

Young campaigners in Malawi pushed the government to amend the constitution of their country to end child marriage.

When this work is done right, we've seen community elders â€” leaders of patriarchal systems where women are valued as less-than â€” reject traditional gender norms and advocate for girls' rights. We've seen young men living in some of the most chauvinistic cultures begin to question their identities and champion gender equality. We've seen boys and girls lobby governments together, working to abolish child marriage.

We have no excuse. This kind of change is possible, but it requires more than bringing down just one villain. We must bring down the system that insidiously and persistently whispers and sometimes screams that women and girls are not equal to men.

So now that we've said #MeToo, let's shout #WeMust so loudly that the glass ceiling shatters and the system breaks.
TITLE: After The Chorus Of #MeToo, Let's Shout #WeMust

TEXT:
Saudi-Arabiens mÃ¤chtiger Kronprinz Mohammed bin Salman plÃ¤diert fÃ¼r einen liberaleren Islam

Er verspricht, extremistische Ideen "sofort zu zerstÃ¶ren"

Die wichtigsten Infos des Textes seht ihr zusammengefasst auch im Video oben

Der saudi-arabische Kronprinz Mohammed bin Salman hat sich in ungewÃ¶hnlich klaren Worten fÃ¼r die Liberalisierung des ultrakonservativen KÃ¶nigreiches ausgesprochen.

"Wir gehen zu dem zurÃ¼ck, wie wir waren: dem moderaten Islam, der offen gegenÃ¼ber der Welt und allen Religionen ist", sagte Mohammed bin Salman am Dienstag auf einer Konferenz in Riad, nachdem er auf die in dem Land vorherrschenden radikalen Ideen angesprochen worden war.

In einem Interview mit der britischen Zeitung "Guardian" wurde er noch deutlicher. Er sagte, Saudi-Arabien sei in den vergangenen 30 Jahren "nicht normal" gewesen. Die Gesellschaft sei nach der Revolution im Iran von rigiden Doktrinen geleitet worden.

"Wir werden keine 30 Jahre unseres Lebens verschwenden"

Der Kronprinz sagte in seiner Rede, dass Saudi-Arabien vor 1979, dem Jahr der blutigen Besetzung der GroÃŸen Moschee in Mekka, anders gewesen sei. Damals hatten radikale Islamisten die bedeutendste Moschee des Islam in ihre Gewalt gebracht. Die MÃ¤nner verlangten den RÃ¼cktritt von KÃ¶nig Chalid und die Einsetzung einer "echt islamischen Regierung".

Die saudi-arabische Armee stÃ¼rmte das islamische Gotteshaus Tage spÃ¤ter. Doch das durch den Ã–lboom aufstrebende Land verÃ¤nderte sich auf Jahrzehnte - die gesellschaftliche Liberalisierung wurde zurÃ¼ckgedrÃ¤ngt.

"70 Prozent der Saudi-Araber sind jÃ¼nger als 30 Jahre. Ganz ehrlich, wir werden keine 30 Jahre unseres Lebens verschwenden, um uns mit extremistischen Ideen zu beschÃ¤ftigen. Wir werden sie heute und sofort zerstÃ¶ren."

Die BevÃ¶lkerung Saudi-Arabiens wolle ein normales Leben. Die Rede des erst 32-jÃ¤hrigen Mohammed bin Salman wurde mehrmals von Applaus unterbrochen.

Experte Steinberg ist Ã¼berrascht

Saudi-Arabien-Experte Guido Steinberg von der Stiftung Wissenschaft und Politik zufolge sind die Aussagen des Kronprinzen in ihrer Deutlichkeit Ã¼berraschend: "Mohammed bin Salman gibt hier zum ersten Mal sehr konkret vor, wohin genau seine Reformen fÃ¼hren sollen: In ein Saudi-Arabien, in dem die konservativen Gelehrten immer weiter an den Rand gedrÃ¤ngt werden und die liberalen Teile des Landes aufatmen und sich auf viel mehr Freiheiten freuen kÃ¶nnen."

Die groÃŸe Frage sei aber, ob dies auch fÃ¼r die etwa zwei Millionen Schiiten im Land das Ende ihrer Diskriminierung bedeuten kÃ¶nnte.

"GÃ¤be es auch fÃ¼r sie Erleichterungen, wÃ¤re Saudi-Arabien rasch ein ganz anderes Land."

Starke Worte vom inoffiziellen Herrscher des Landes

Mohammed bin Salman, der gegenÃ¼ber seinem greisen Vater KÃ¶nig Salman als inoffizieller Herrscher Saudi-Arabiens gilt, wurden in den vergangenen Monaten schon eine Reihe von MaÃŸnahmen zu Ã–ffnung der Gesellschaft zugeschrieben.

Die herausragendste VerÃ¤nderung ist dabei wohl die, Frauen das Fahren von Autos zu erlauben - als letztes Land der Erde. Die neue Regelung soll im Sommer nÃ¤chsten Jahres in Kraft treten.

Umstrittener Herrscher

Unter den jungen Saudis gilt Mohammed bin Salman als HoffnungstrÃ¤ger fÃ¼r eine modernere Gesellschaft. In Saudi-Arabien ist vor allem die Gleichberechtigung noch in weiter Ferne. Frauen mÃ¼ssen alle groÃŸen Lebensentscheidungen bis hin zu Reisen von einem mÃ¤nnlichen Vormund absegnen lassen. Zudem gelten strenge Bekleidungsvorschriften fÃ¼r Frauen in der Ã–ffentlichkeit.

International hat sich der junge Thronfolger durch sein aggressives Auftreten jedoch schon viel Kritik eingehandelt. So ist er fÃ¼r die verheerende, von Saudi-Arabien angefÃ¼hrte, MilitÃ¤rkampagne im Nachbarland Jemen verantwortlich. Durch Luftangriffe in Gebieten unter Kontrolle der Huthi-Rebellen starben bereits Tausende Zivilisten.

Mohammed bin Salman soll auch einer der Hauptakteure bei der Blockade des Nachbar-Emirats Katar in den vergangenen Monaten sein.

TITLE: Saudi-arabischer Kronprinz verspricht "moderaten Islam"

TEXT:
ADVERTISEMENT

The foster mother of a 3-year-old Indian girl, whose body was found on Sunday from a culvert near their home in suburban Dallas, has denied any involvement in the death of her daughter.

Lawyers Michelle Nolte and Gregg Gibbs, representing Sini Mathews published a statement late yesterday saying she denied any involvement in the death of her adoptive daughter.

In the statement, the lawyers insist that Mathews cooperated with the Richardson Police investigation into her daughter's disappearance on October 7. She was "interrogated for hours by several officers with no attorney present" a few days later, as per the statement.

The statement adds, "Now that Mr Mathews has turned himself into the police and told them what happened to Sherin, we see no need for Mrs Mathews to endure further police interrogation. She had nothing to do with Sherin's death or the removal of her body from the home."

The lawyers write that Mathews is "trying to grieve for her lost daughter while still caring for her remaining daughter. She is struggling to pick up the pieces of a shattered life."

"Now that Mr Mathews has turned himself into the police and told them what happened to Sherin, we see no need for Mrs Mathews to endure further police interrogation. She had nothing to do with Sherin's death or the removal of her body from the home."

Texas Department of Family and Protective Services spokesperson confirmed that Mathews' four-year-old daughter remains in foster care.

Richardson Police had no immediate comment to the statement.

The police previously said Sini Mathews initially cooperated in the investigation on October 7, but then stopped. This week, police said Mathews provided dental records and identified clothing found with Sherin's body in order to help the medical examiner make a positive ID.

Police also said Mathews never provided a full account of what happened when Sherin died.

Wesley Mathews is the only person charged with a crime in Sherin's disappearance and death. On Monday, police arrested him for a second time on an injury to a child charge after he told them that Sherin choked on milk.

According to court records, Wesley Mathews previously told detectives his wife was sleeping when Sherin disappeared.

Earlier, Wesley Mathews, was booked into to the Dallas County Jail yesterday and has been placed under suicide watch.

Mathews originally told police his daughter Sherin disappeared while being punished, when she was forced to stand outside by a tree at 3 am for not drinking her milk. Later when the body was found, he changed his story and said that his daughter choked to death after he "physically assisted" her in drinking her milk.

Meanwhile, a petition has been started by community leader Father Thomas to not hand over the body of Sherin Mathews to her parents, and rather to the community, so that proper memorial and burial service could be done.
TITLE: Foster Mother Of 3-Year-Old Dead Indian Girl 'Struggling To Pick Up The Pieces Of A Shattered Life'

SUMMARY:
Jindal Global UniversityAttempts by the Indian government to deport tens of thousands of Rohingya refugees have thrust the country's laws into the spotlight.
For one thing, it means the majority of refugees in India head for cities â€“ where there is the possibility of anonymity and opportunities for work.
Delhi is often the preferred destination for refugee groups that fall within the UNHCR's mandate.
Because of their perceived resilience and community cohesion, they are viewed as a model refugee community.
One of UNHCR's NGO partners has even used their facilities to run other refugee services.
TEXT:
ADVERTISEMENT

Jessica Field, O.P. Jindal Global University

Attempts by the Indian government to deport tens of thousands of Rohingya refugees have thrust the country's laws into the spotlight.

Lawyers representing the Rohingyas have reiterated the constitutional right (of citizens and non-citizens alike) to equality, life and personal liberty in India. Meanwhile, the government has claimed such refugees may pose a security threat to the state.

Both sides have been making their case at the Supreme Court.

What effect does this legal precariousness have on the ground? For one thing, it means the majority of refugees in India head for cities â€“ where there is the possibility of anonymity and opportunities for work.

Delhi is often the preferred destination for refugee groups that fall within the UNHCR's mandate. In the capital, these groups have the possibility to get refugee certificates and access to certain support services, such as education, health, livelihoods, and legal counselling.

However, these services are limited in number, reach, and budget. They can also be curtailed at short notice. Often, refugees in urban India can only rely on themselves.

Self-help groups

Self-organised social safety nets look different for different groups. In the early 1990s, nearly 50,000 Sikh and Hindu refugees fled Afghanistan following a spike in ethno-religious violence. In 1992, a group of them in Delhi set up their own organisation - the Khalsa Diwan Welfare Society (KDWS) - dedicated to the support of their refugee community. KDWS is funded through membership fees, and helps other Sikh and Hindu Afghan refugees (numbering around 15,000 in Delhi) struggling to receive the assistance they need from the Indian government.

It focuses on education and skills development, including teaching devotional music, language classes, stitching, and computer skills. More informally it offers reconciliation and support for domestic disputes and grievances. Because of their perceived resilience and community cohesion, they are viewed as a model refugee community. One of UNHCR's NGO partners has even used their facilities to run other refugee services.

Chin refugees from Myanmar, too, have their own community support systems. A minority religious and ethnic group persecuted by the Burmese military, they have fled to India in waves over the last four decades and are settled primarily in Mizoram, Manipur and Delhi. In Delhi they number around 4,000 and are largely clustered in the west of the city. The community has a hired floor in an apartment block where â€“ with the support of their church and some NGOs â€“ they run language, computer, and stitching classes, and also previously, their own clinic with a Chin doctor.

As a Christian community, the church is an important part of their urban social safety net. The same goes for Christian Afghans, who number a few hundred in India's capital and live in the south of the city. "It's good," explained a young Christian Afghan to our research team, "because of the church I have some friends."

Some of the Rohingyas have also self-organised. A small number of prominent youths established a Rohingya Literacy Programme and women's empowerment initiatives, as well as actively networking with the aid community to augment support and services. Their football team the Shining Stars, is an important social initiative offering bridging opportunities to other groups in Delhi, as they play solidarity matches with other teams in the city.

Challenges

The existence of these community organisations speaks of the opportunities that exist in a city. Urban environments more readily provide enough working people in close proximity to enable a membership model (such as with KDWS). Cities also offer malleable spaces, for the transformation of apartments into community centres (such as for the Chins) or wasteland into a football pitch (for the Rohingya Shining Stars).

However, it would be a mistake to laud these community initiatives as solutions to the problem of ensuring adequate refugee protection in India. Many arise due to severe access gaps in Indian public services.

It was the discrimination they experienced in Indian schools and clinics that led the Chins to establish parallel schools and a health clinic. Moreover, not only is sustainability precarious (the clinic run by a Chin refugee doctor had to close when he was resettled), it also reinforces segregation. The same Christian Afghan refugee who praised the support of his church network also spoke about such difficulties. He said: "It is unlucky to be stuck in such a situation [as a refugee] ... the loneliness is different."

The Rohingya youths have established their literacy and empowerment initiatives partly because of gaps in services and lack of staying power of many aid organisations. They describe a lack of funds as preventing sustainability and expansion. "The challenge with this job is that for me to help such people, it requires money," one explained, "but in my community people are illiterate and poor. How will they pay?"

Moreover, these self-organised communities can exacerbate â€“ or create â€“ community hierarchies, discrimination and exclusion. As another refugee in Delhi explained: "The community leaders are selected on the basis of their connectivity with the NGOs." This so often means men with a command of English.

While self-organised groups provide essential safety nets for refugees in Delhi, they are clearly not a replacement for governmental and NGO services. India not only urgently requires a robust, inclusive legal framework that protects refugees, the government and NGOs also need to re-approach how they can better support vulnerable communities to access wider public and aid services.

This increased support requires the government to change its restrictive position on humanitarian and development NGOs. Too many, especially those with international connections, are being weakened or closed down with recent changes in laws regulating foreign funding. Many argue this is driven by ideological motives to quash dissent.

This is exacerbating the pressure on already vulnerable refugee communities to make their own safety nets.

Jessica Field, Assistant Professor, Jindal School of International Affairs, O.P. Jindal Global University

This article was originally published on The Conversation. Read the original article.
TITLE: Refugees In India Have To Fend For Themselves â€“ We've Been Talking To Them About How They Manage

TEXT:
Los kenianos votan este jueves en una tensa elecciÃ³n presidencial, boicoteada por la oposiciÃ³n, que sin sorpresa darÃ¡ un nuevo mandato al presidente saliente Uhuru Kenyatta.

En varios bastiones de la oposiciÃ³n han estallado mÃºltiples altercadosentre la policÃ­a y manifestantes que intentaban bloquear los accesos a los colegios electorales, segÃºn ha constatado la agencia AFP.

En Kibera, en las afueras de Nairobi, la policÃ­a ha lanzado gases lacrimÃ³genos y ha disparado al aire para dispersar a los manifestantes. Se produjeron situaciones similares en Kisumu, Migori (oeste), asÃ­ como en el suburbio de Mathare en Nairobi, feudos del lÃ­der de la oposiciÃ³n Raila Odinga.

Unos 19,6 millones de electores inscritos estÃ¡n convocados a las urnas este jueves luego de que la Corte Suprema invalidara los resultados de los comicios del 8 de agosto por irregularidades, que la oposiciÃ³n habÃ­a impugnado.

Un seguidor del partido opositor NASA durante la protesta contra las elecciones

De cara a estos nuevos comicios, la ComisiÃ³n Electoral ha emprendido algunas reformas, pero la oposiciÃ³n estima que la instancia sigue siendo parcial y mayoritariamente a la orden del partido en el poder.

Odinga, de 72 aÃ±os, ha llamado a sus partidarios a boicotear la elecciÃ³n, estimando que las condiciones de una elecciÃ³n transparente y justa no estaban reunidas.

En algunas circunscripciones en el estado de Kisumu, asÃ­ como en la ciudad de Migori (oeste) los colegios electorales no han abierto.

No entiendo que no se haya organizado nada, aunque sÃ³lo 10 personas quieran votar los colegios electorales deberÃ­an estar abiertos

"No entiendo que no se haya organizado nada, aunque sÃ³lo 10 personas quieran votar los colegios electorales deberÃ­an estar abiertos", ha protestado Joshau Nyamori, de 42 aÃ±os, partidario de Odinga, que no ha podido votar en Kisumu, regiÃ³n mayoritariamente de etnia luo a la que pertenece el rival de Kenyatta. "Estoy preocupado porque la gente estÃ¡ obligada a quedarse en sus casas, la gente tiene miedo de ser atacada", ha lamentado.

ENFRENTAMIENTOS DESDE AGOSTO

Al menos 40 personas han muerto desde el 8 de agosto, la mayorÃ­a por la represiÃ³n policial, segÃºn organizaciones de defensa de los derechos humanos. Desde entonces el ambiente polÃ­tico es pÃ©simo.

El 8 de agosto Kenyatta se impuso con el 54,27% de los votos, contra 44,74% para Odinga. Pero los comicios fueron invalidados y la ConstituciÃ³n prevÃ© la celebraciÃ³n de nuevas elecciones, algo inÃ©dito en el continente africano.

La Corte Suprema justificÃ³ su decisiÃ³n por irregularidades en la transmisiÃ³n de resultados, sin culpar a ninguno de los candidatos, por lo que la responsabilidad cayÃ³ sobre la ComisiÃ³n Electoral.

La decisiÃ³n de la Corte enardeciÃ³ a Odinga, que habÃ­a sido candidato a la presidencia en 1997, 2007 y 2013. El opositor presionÃ³ para que la ComisiÃ³n Electoral efectuara reformas, que considerÃ³ luego como tÃ­midas.

Antes de los comicios del jueves el mismo presidente de la ComisiÃ³n, Wafula Chebukati, admitiÃ³ que la instancia no podÃ­a garantizar unos comicios creÃ­bles.

Odinga utilizÃ³ este pretexto para anunciar el 10 de octubre que se retiraba de la elecciÃ³n, lo que no formalizÃ³. Su nombre sigue figurando en las boletas electorales, junto al de Kenyatta y seis otros candidatos.

El principal rival de Kenyatta denunciÃ³ el miÃ©rcoles una "dictadura" y pidiÃ³ la creaciÃ³n de un "movimiento nacional de resistencia" contra "la autoridad ilegÃ­tima del gobierno".

Salvo sorpresas, Uhuru Kenyatta, lÃ­der de la etnia kikuyu mayoritaria en el paÃ­s e hijo del padre de la independencia del paÃ­s, Jomo Kenyatta, deberÃ­a ser reelecto, aunque el proceso puede no ser inmediato por la multitud de recursos que podrÃ­a interponer la oposiciÃ³n.

Esta es la peor crisis polÃ­tica de los Ãºltimos diez aÃ±os. Las profundas divisiones sociales y Ã©tnicas de Kenia, de 48 millones de habitantes, resurgieron.

EstÃ¡ latente el temor a que se reproduzcan los incidentes desatados despuÃ©s de la presidencial de 2007, que sumiÃ³ al paÃ­s en la peor violencia polÃ­tica y Ã©tnica desde su independencia en 1963, con un saldo de al menos 1.100 personas muertas.
TITLE: Kenia acude a las urnas bajo el boicot de la oposiciÃ³n

Le fonds Desjardins Capital PME sera dotÃ© d'une enveloppe de 100 millions $ provenant de Gestion privÃ©e Desjardins et Desjardins Capital au cours de sa premiÃ¨re annÃ©e d'existence.
Les investissements s'effectueront par l'entremise des actifs des clients de Gestion privÃ©e Desjardins â€” qui se spÃ©cialise dans la gestion de portefeuille â€” ainsi que de Desjardins Capital.
En plus d'investir, les deux institutions Ã©pauleront les entreprises et quÃ©bÃ©coises qui ambitionnent de croÃ®tre de l'autre cÃ´tÃ© de l'Atlantique.
Celui-ci n'a pas fermÃ© la porte Ã  la possibilitÃ© que d'autres investisseurs se joignent Ã©ventuellement Ã  l'aventure.
TEXT:
Bloomberg via Getty Images

Dans le but de soutenir la croissance des petites et moyennes entreprises et de maintenir la propriÃ©tÃ© quÃ©bÃ©coise de fleurons, le Mouvement Desjardins lance un fonds d'investissement dont les engagements pourraient atteindre 500 millions $ d'ici cinq ans.

Le fonds Desjardins Capital PME sera dotÃ© d'une enveloppe de 100 millions $ provenant de Gestion privÃ©e Desjardins et Desjardins Capital au cours de sa premiÃ¨re annÃ©e d'existence.

Ainsi, la coopÃ©rative financiÃ¨re pourrait par exemple cibler des entreprises qui gÃ©nÃ¨rent un chiffre d'affaires de Â«plusieurs centaines de millionsÂ» de dollars et qui ne sont pas nÃ©cessairement de Â«grandes sociÃ©tÃ©s internationalesÂ», a expliquÃ© son prÃ©sident et chef de la direction, Guy Cormier.

Â«Souvent, on ne connaÃ®t pas (ces PME) et Ã  un certain moment, les propriÃ©taires atteignent un Ã¢ge oÃ¹ ils souhaitent transfÃ©rer leur entreprise, a-t-il expliquÃ©, jeudi, au cours d'une confÃ©rence tÃ©lÃ©phonique. C'est parfois Ã  ce moment qu'elles peuvent Ãªtre achetÃ©es par des sociÃ©tÃ©s Ã©trangÃ¨res.Â»

Ã€ son avis, Desjardins peut intervenir, notamment en prenant une position majoritaire dans l'actionnariat pour ensuite dÃ©nicher l'Ã©quipe de direction adÃ©quate pour maintenir le siÃ¨ge social de la compagnie en question dans la province.

Ce nouveau fonds vise Ã©galement Ã  fournir une forme de capital de risque Ã  de plus petites PME qui caressent des ambitions de croissance, que ce soit Ã  l'international ou non.

Initialement, Desjardins prÃ©voit des prises de participation sous forme de capital-actions ou de dette subordonnÃ©e pouvant osciller dans une fourchette de 100 000 $ Ã  10 millions $, a-t-on prÃ©cisÃ©.

Les investissements s'effectueront par l'entremise des actifs des clients de Gestion privÃ©e Desjardins â€” qui se spÃ©cialise dans la gestion de portefeuille â€” ainsi que de Desjardins Capital.

InterrogÃ©, M. Cormier a affirmÃ© que les investisseurs au sein de la coopÃ©rative financiÃ¨re Ã©taient toujours intÃ©ressÃ©s Ã  diversifier leur portefeuille en ayant accÃ¨s Ã  de nouvelles catÃ©gories d'actifs.

Â«Il y a aussi beaucoup d'Ã©pargnants et d'investisseurs qui nous passaient le message Ã  l'effet qu'ils aimeraient contribuer au dÃ©veloppement Ã©conomique du QuÃ©bec en plus d'investir dans des entreprises quÃ©bÃ©coisesÂ», a-t-il affirmÃ©.

Les yeux sur l'Europe

ParallÃ¨lement au nouveau fonds destinÃ© aux PME, Desjardins a Ã©galement conclu un partenariat avec la sociÃ©tÃ© franÃ§aise Groupe Siparex, spÃ©cialisÃ©e dans le financement de projets de dÃ©veloppement et de transfert d'entreprises.

En plus d'investir, les deux institutions Ã©pauleront les entreprises et quÃ©bÃ©coises qui ambitionnent de croÃ®tre de l'autre cÃ´tÃ© de l'Atlantique.

Â«Nous voulons jouer un rÃ´le d'accompagnement financier, donner confiance aux entreprises et faciliter les contacts afin de gÃ©nÃ©rer de la croissance organiqueÂ», a expliquÃ© le prÃ©sident du Groupe Siparex, Bertrand Rambaud.

Desjardins et son partenaire franÃ§ais souhaitent injecter plus de 100 millions $ Ã  court terme, mais cet objectif pourrait doubler dans un horizon pas si lointain, a indiquÃ© M. Cormier. Celui-ci n'a pas fermÃ© la porte Ã  la possibilitÃ© que d'autres investisseurs se joignent Ã©ventuellement Ã  l'aventure.

M. Rambaud a expliquÃ© que Siparex avait dÃ©jÃ  identifiÃ© des entreprises franÃ§aises intÃ©ressÃ©es Ã  mettre le pied au QuÃ©bec, Ã©voquant au passage les secteurs de l'aÃ©ronautique ainsi que de l'automobile. Des annonces pourraient avoir lieu bientÃ´t.

Le mouvement coopÃ©ratif quÃ©bÃ©cois affirme que les entrepreneurs quÃ©bÃ©cois avaient lancÃ© le signal que l'entrÃ©e en vigueur provisoire de l'Accord Ã©conomique global entre le Canada et l'Union europÃ©enne le 21 septembre rendait encore plus attrayants les marchÃ©s europÃ©ens.

Â«L'Europe reprÃ©sente un marchÃ© de plus de 700 millions de personnes, a soulignÃ© M. Cormier. En mÃªme temps, nous sommes tous trÃ¨s conscients qu'il y a un certain contexte d'incertitude en ce qui a trait Ã  nos Ã©changes avec nos voisins du sud.Â»

CrÃ©Ã© il y a 40 ans, le Groupe Siparex a un actif sous gestion d'environ 1,8 milliard d'euros. Outre le Vieux-Continent, la sociÃ©tÃ© est prÃ©sente au Canada ainsi qu'en Afrique du Nord.

VOIR AUSSI:
TITLE: Desjardins veut soutenir la croissance des petites et moyennes entreprises

SUMMARY:
If you're a big fan of peanut butter, you're probably known to sneak it into any meal, snack and dessert you can.
These cookies look like your standard delicious chocolate cookies, but they have a peanut butter surprise.
These peanut butter-stuffed chocolate cookies are easy and quick to whip up.
First off you'll need to make the peanut butter filling by combining peanut butter and powdered sugar.
For an extra chocolate garnish, swirl melted chocolate or chocolate hazelnut spread on top of each cookie.
TEXT:
If you're a big fan of peanut butter, you're probably known to sneak it into any meal, snack and dessert you can. Maybe you're a bit embarrassed about your peanut butter obsession (they just don't understand us), or maybe you wear your empty jar with pride. Either way, it's time to make the cookies of your dreams.

These cookies look like your standard delicious chocolate cookies, but they have a peanut butter surprise. Once you bite into those fudgy cookies, you hit the smooth, sweet-and-salty peanut butter filling. They're basically a cookie meets peanut butter cup.

If you're not a big baker, don't worry. These peanut butter-stuffed chocolate cookies are easy and quick to whip up.

First off you'll need to make the peanut butter filling by combining peanut butter and powdered sugar. Scoop the peanut butter mixture into balls and freeze while you make the cookie dough.

Once you've got your dough it's time to assemble the cookies. First, place a tablespoon of dough onto a baking tray and flatten. Then place a ball of peanut butter on top of each disc of dough. Last, place a second disc of flattened dough on top of the cookies, seal around the edges and dunk each cookie in sugar. Pop the cookies in the oven and prepare for dangerously good peanut butter-stuffed cookies.

For an extra chocolate garnish, swirl melted chocolate or chocolate hazelnut spread on top of each cookie.

Check out the video above and follow the full recipe here.
TITLE: Watch: How To Make Peanut Butter-Stuffed Chocolate Cookies

SUMMARY:
ADVERTISEMENTThe Taj Mahal has been at the centre of controversy over the last few weeks.
And even as Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath visits the most famous historic monument in the country, reports suggest that there are no takers for the monument under the government's 'Adopt A Heritage' project.
IANS reported that a cleanliness drive has already been launched at the monument for Adityanath's visit.
Indian Express, meanwhile, reported that the CM will lay foundation stone for a tourist pathway from Taj Mahal to Agra Fort.
This gaff was followed by BJP leader Sangeet Som's highly controversial opinions of the Taj Mahal, where he said it was a blot on the Indian culture because it was built by 'traitors'.
TEXT:
ADVERTISEMENT

The Taj Mahal has been at the centre of controversy over the last few weeks. And even as Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath visits the most famous historic monument in the country, reports suggest that there are no takers for the monument under the government's 'Adopt A Heritage' project.

The Times of India reports that while Qutub Minar, Jantar Mantar, Purana Qila, Safdarjung's Tomb and Agrasen ki Baoli in Delhi, Odisha's Sun Temple, the Ajanta Ellora caves have found private players who would maintain the monuments, the Taj Mahal is still waiting for adoption.

The Adopt A Heritage project started by the government assigns the responsibility of heritage sites and monuments "to private sector companies, public sector companies and individuals for the development of tourist amenities. They would become 'Monument Mitras' and adopt the sites. The basic and advanced amenities of the tourist destinations would be provided by them. They would also look after the operations and the maintenance of the amenities".

Tourism secretary Rashmi Verma told the Times of India that the Taj Mahal would still be up for adoption in case a private entity wanted to take it up for adoption.

Meanwhile, Adityanath has already reached Agra was his much publicised visit to the heritage structure.

IANS reported that a cleanliness drive has already been launched at the monument for Adityanath's visit.

Indian Express, meanwhile, reported that the CM will lay foundation stone for a tourist pathway from Taj Mahal to Agra Fort.

His visit comes close on the heels of controversy after controversy regarding the monument. First, the Taj Mahal, which is arguably one of the most visited tourist spots in India, was left out of the Uttar Pradesh government's official tourism booklet. It was later added to it.

This gaff was followed by BJP leader Sangeet Som's highly controversial opinions of the Taj Mahal, where he said it was a blot on the Indian culture because it was built by 'traitors'.

Recently, Haryana Minister Anil Vij called it a beautiful graveyard.
TITLE: As Adityanath Visits Taj On Cleanliness Drive, No Takers For The Monument In Govt Scheme
