SUMMARY:
Auch der ehemalige CDU-GeneralsekretÃ¤r Ruprecht Polenz sprach sich fÃ¼r eine Kurskorrektur in der Asylpolitik aus.
Ich teile die Sorge der SchÃ¼lerinnen und SchÃ¼ler in NÃ¼rnberg und Duisburg.â€œDennoch gibt es immer noch Menschen in Deutschland, die Abschiebungen nach Afghanistan fÃ¼r eine gute Idee halten.
Laut einer 2016 verÃ¶ffentlichten Studie ist die afghanische Hauptstadt die am fÃ¼nftschnellsten wachsende Metropole der Welt.
Aber genauso gut sind wir alle auch fÃ¼r das Schlechte mitverantwortlich, was nach dem womÃ¶glich voreiligen Abzug der Truppen entstanden ist.
Wir kÃ¶nnen als Deutsche nicht die Amerikaner fÃ¼r den Aufstieg des IS verantwortlich machen, aber gleichzeitig unsere Verantwortung fÃ¼r das Chaos in Afghanistan klein reden.
TEXT:
Die TÃ¤ter gingen mit unvorstellbarer BrutalitÃ¤t vor: Mitten im belebten Diplomatenviertel der afghanischen Hauptstadt Kabul jagten sie sich mit einen Lastwagen voller Sprengstoff in die Luft. Die Detonation war so heftig, dass selbst hunderte Meter weiter, im GebÃ¤ude der deutschen Botschaft, noch Scheiben sprangen und Menschen zu Schaden kamen.

Die vorlÃ¤ufige Bilanz des verheerenden Anschlags vom Mittwoch: 90 Tote, 400 Verletzte. Und wahrscheinlich haben wir in Deutschland dieses Verbrechen nur deswegen wahrgenommen, weil dieses Mal eben auch Deutsche betroffen waren.

Das sagt eigentlich alles Ã¼ber den Zynismus aus, mit dem wir derzeit auf Afghanistan blicken.

Die Abschiebungen sollen konservative AnhÃ¤nger mobilisieren

In Deutschland und Ã–sterreich werden in diesem Herbst neue Parlamente gewÃ¤hlt. In beiden LÃ¤ndern stellen konservative Parteien die Innenminister. Und deshalb gehen die Abschiebungen von FlÃ¼chtlingen nach Afghanistan weiter. Offiziell, weil Afghanistan ein â€sicheres Herkunftslandâ€œ sei.

In Wahrheit geht es Politikern wie Thomas de MaiziÃ¨re (CDU) und Wolfgang Sobotka (Ã–VP) darum, vor den Wahlen ihre konservativen AnhÃ¤nger zu mobilisieren. Sie wollen â€StÃ¤rkeâ€œ zeigen und beweisen, dass Zeiten vorbei sind, in denen â€Massenâ€œ von FlÃ¼chtlingen nach Mitteleuropa â€strÃ¶mtenâ€œ.

Das deutsche Innenministerium setzte einen geplanten Abschiebeflug nur deswegen aus, weil man â€RÃ¼cksicht auf die BotschaftsangehÃ¶rigenâ€œ nehmen mÃ¼sse, so Innenminister de MaiziÃ¨re.

SchÃ¼ler wollen Abschiebungen verhindern

WÃ¤hrenddessen spielen sich vor unser aller Augen Dramen ab.

In NÃ¼rnberg wollten SchÃ¼ler einer Berufsschule einen Klassenkameraden aus Afghanistan vor dessen Abschiebung beschÃ¼tzen. Man muss sich das nur vorstellen: Offenbar war dieser junge Mann so beliebt und akzeptiert in der Gemeinschaft, dass eine komplette Schulklasse zivilen Ungehorsam ausÃ¼bte und den Polizeiwagen blockierte.

Die Antwort der Polizei war rohe Gewalt: Um die Blockade aufzulÃ¶sen, wurde eine Hundestaffel eingesetzt, Reizgas versprÃ¼ht und mit GummiknÃ¼ppeln geprÃ¼gelt. Es gab Verletzte unter den SchÃ¼lern.

Auch in Duisburg wurde ein in Deutschland geborener SchÃ¼ler mit afghanischem Pass aus dem Unterricht geholt und abgeschoben.



In Ã–sterreich wurde am Morgen des Anschlags ein junger Afghane abgeschoben, der aus seinem Heimatland wegen einer geplanten Konvertierung zum Christentum mit dem Tode bedroht wurde, wie Aktivisten schreiben. Aber das schient nicht sonderlich viel MitgefÃ¼hl bei den Ã¶sterreichischen BehÃ¶rden auszulÃ¶sen.

Auch der ehemalige CDU-GeneralsekretÃ¤r Ruprecht Polenz sprach sich fÃ¼r eine Kurskorrektur in der Asylpolitik aus. â€Niemand zwingt Deutschland dazu, abgelehnte Asylbewerber abzuschieben. Wir kÃ¶nnen die Abschiebung aussetzen, wenn das Herkunftsland unsicher ist. Ob das der Fall ist, beurteilen wir selbstâ€œ, so Polenz. â€Der schreckliche Terroranschlag in Kabul sollte uns bei den Abschiebungen nach Afghanistan innehalten lassen. Ich teile die Sorge der SchÃ¼lerinnen und SchÃ¼ler in NÃ¼rnberg und Duisburg.â€œ

Dennoch gibt es immer noch Menschen in Deutschland, die Abschiebungen nach Afghanistan fÃ¼r eine gute Idee halten. Hier sind neun Fakten, die diese Leute kennen sollten.

1. Seit Jahren steigt die Zahl der Kriegsopfer in Afghanistan

Und eine Trendwende ist nicht in Sicht. Der Krieg ist seit dem Abzug der Nato-Kampftruppen Ende 2014 noch schlimmer geworden, im toten Winkel der WeltÃ¶ffentlichkeit entwickelt sich eine TragÃ¶die.

Seit 2009 ist die Zahl der Kriegsopfer in jedem Jahr angestiegen, im Jahr 2016 (11.500 Tote und Verletzte) kamen in Afghanistan fast doppelt so viele Menschen zu Schaden wie auf dem HÃ¶hepunkt der Isaf-gefÃ¼hrten Operationen in den Jahren 2010 und 2011.

Das Jahr 2016 war fÃ¼r die afghanische ZivilbevÃ¶lkerung das tÃ¶dlichste seit dem brutalen BÃ¼rgerkrieg Mitte der 1990er-Jahre, wie ein UN-Bericht im Februar zeigte. Auch in diesem Jahr hat es bereits zahlreiche Tote gegeben â€“ was unter anderem daran liegt, dass derzeit gleich mehrere radikalislamistische Gruppierungen um Macht und Einfluss kÃ¤mpfen.

Der EU-Botschafter in Afghanistan, Franz-Michael Mellbin, bilanzierte Ende 2016: "Hier herrscht Krieg, der Feind ist entschlossen. Die Zahl der zivilen Opfer steigt. Die Kurve ist eindeutig: Der Kampf mit dem Feind wird schwieriger und weitet sich aus. Das ist eine sehr schwere Situation fÃ¼r viele Afghanen.â€œ

Dass wir mittlerweile nicht mehr so genau hinschauen, weil die deutschen Kampftruppen im Jahr 2014 abgezogen wurden, macht die Sache nicht besser. Im Gegenteil: Dieser Konflikt hÃ¤tte viel mehr Aufmerksamkeit verdient, weil Millionen Menschen unter den Kampfhandlungen leiden.

2. Fast ganz Afghanistan ist ein Kriegsgebiet

Innenminister Thomas de MaiziÃ¨re spricht davon, dass die Lage fÃ¼r abgeschobene Afghanen in vielen Regionen "hinreichend sicher" sei. Was fÃ¼r ein fataler Irrtum. In 31 von 34 afghanischen Provinzen gab es im Jahr 2016 laut UNHCR bewaffnete KÃ¤mpfe.

Das UN-Hilfswerk reagierte im Januar auf eine Anfrage der Bundesregierung. Die Sicherheitslage in Afghanistan habe sich seit April 2016 nochmals "deutlich verschlechtertâ€œ.

Das UNHCR mache zudem selbst keine Unterscheidung zwischen "sicherenâ€œ und "unsicherenâ€œ Provinzen, dazu sei die Lage zu "volatilâ€œ, sprich: Sie Ã¤ndert sich stÃ¤ndig. Fast das gesamte Staatsgebiet sei von einem bewaffneten Konflikt betroffen.

Von "hinreichend sicheren" Gebieten kann also keine Rede sein. Das ist eine EinschÃ¤tzung, die Herr de MaiziÃ¨re weltexklusiv hat.

3. Kabul platzt aus allen NÃ¤hten

FÃ¼r Menschen, die nach Afghanistan abgeschoben werden, gibt es oft nur die MÃ¶glichkeit, in einer der groÃŸen StÃ¤dte zu leben. Das hat familiÃ¤re, finanzielle und wirtschaftliche GrÃ¼nde. In den Provinzen kann man oft nur von der Agrarwirtschaft leben â€“ das geht aber nur, wenn man dort Land besitzt. Wer keine Existenz hat, versucht sich, in Kabul eine aufzubauen.

Doch die Stadt platzt mittlerweile aus allen NÃ¤hten: Allein im vergangenen Jahr sind aufgrund der weitreichenden Kampfhandlungen mehrere Hunderttausend Menschen in den GroÃŸraum Kabul geflÃ¼chtet.

Laut einer 2016 verÃ¶ffentlichten Studie ist die afghanische Hauptstadt die am fÃ¼nftschnellsten wachsende Metropole der Welt. Pro Quadratkilometer leben dort mittlerweile gut 14.000 Menschen. Zum Vergleich: In der am dichtesten besiedelten Millionenstadt Deutschlands (MÃ¼nchen) sind es etwa 4.700 Menschen pro Quadratkilometer.

Jede neue Abschiebung verschÃ¤rft den Leidensdruck in Kabul.

4. Auch die BehÃ¶rden erkennen, dass FlÃ¼chtlinge aus Afghanistan Schutz brauchen

Im Jahr 2015 bekamen laut der Organisation "Pro Asylâ€œ insgesamt 78 Prozent der FlÃ¼chtlinge aus Afghanistan in Deutschland einen Schutzstatus. Eine weitaus Ã¼berdurchschnittliche Quote. Offenbar sind auch die BehÃ¶rden davon Ã¼berzeugt, dass in Afghanistan Krieg herrscht.

WÃ¤hrenddessen macht de MaiziÃ¨re ungeachtet Stimmung gegen Asylbewerber aus Afghanistan. Eine leicht durchschaubare populistische Politik, die wohl einzig dazu dienen soll, die Konservativen in der Union mit Forderungen nach "Abschiebungâ€œ ruhig zu stellen. Einfach erkennbar ist dahinter die Angst vor einer neuen FlÃ¼chtlingsbewegung und weiteren Panikreaktionen aus dem konservativen Milieu.

De MaiziÃ¨re will klar machen: So etwas wie die FlÃ¼chtlingskrise im Herbst 2015 soll sich nicht noch einmal wiederholen. Doch so einfach ist es nicht. Denn der Krieg in Afghanistan existiert. Und er fordert stÃ¤ndig weitere Opfer.

5. Die Zahl der BinnenflÃ¼chtlinge in Afghanistan hat ein Rekordniveau erreicht

Die Koordinierungsagentur der Vereinten Nationen fÃ¼r humanitÃ¤re Hilfe (OCHA) kommt in ihrem Bericht fÃ¼r das Jahr 2016 zu einem eindeutigen Ergebnis: Noch nie gab es so viele BinnenflÃ¼chtlinge in Afghanistan wie im vergangenen Jahr. Insgesamt seien 623.000 Menschen innerhalb des Landes auf der Flucht vor Gewalt gewesen.

Und das sind nur die registrierten FÃ¤lle. In einem Land ohne geregeltes Meldesystem wie Afghanistan dÃ¼rfte die Dunkelziffer weitaus hÃ¶her liegen.

FÃ¼r dieses Jahr rechnet die OCHA mit einem weiteren drastischen Anstieg. Insgesamt dÃ¼rften dann etwa eine Million Menschen als BinnenflÃ¼chtlinge registriert sein.

Seit der Schneeschmelze im FrÃ¼hjahr haben die Taliban mit einer â€FrÃ¼hjahrsoffensiveâ€œ begonnen. Allein bei einem Angriff auf die einstmals von Bundeswehrsoldaten kontrollierte Provinzhauptstadt Kunduz flohen Anfang Mai Tausende Menschen.

6. Die afghanische Regierung kontrolliert nur noch etwa die HÃ¤lfte des Staatsgebiets

Laut einem Bericht des amerikanischen Inspekteurs fÃ¼r den Wiederaufbau Afghanistans kontrolliert die afghanische Regierung nur noch 57 Prozent des Staatsgebiets. Insgesamt 41 der 407 Bezirke des Landes seien fest in der Hand der Taliban, weitere 133 seien derzeit umkÃ¤mpft.

7. Der IS ist in Afghanistan auf dem Vormarsch

Weitgehend unbeachtet hat auch der sogenannte Islamische Staat in Afghanistan FuÃŸ gefasst. Die Terrormiliz ist dort zwar lÃ¤ngst nicht so stark prÃ¤sent wie in Syrien und dem Irak, konnte dort aber bereits einige militÃ¤rische Erfolge verbuchen: Zeitweise kontrollierte der IS einige Distrikte in der Ã¶stlichen Provinz Nangahar und kÃ¤mpfte auch in der Provinz Ghor.

In der Provinz Logari war der IS bereits dabei, staatliche Strukturen aufzubauen: So betrieben die Terroristen dort eine eigene Radiostation. Anfang Mai wurden bei schweren Gefechten in Logari 30 IS-KÃ¤mpfer getÃ¶tet.

8. Die Taliban verfÃ¼gen Ã¼ber gute Kontakte zu den afghanischen SicherheitskrÃ¤ften

Anders ist es nicht erklÃ¤rbar, wie im April einige als Soldaten getarnte Taliban-KÃ¤mpfer mit Insider-Wissen auf ein Areal der afghanischen Armee vordrangen und dort 140 Menschen wÃ¤hrend des Freitagsgebets erschossen. Der Anschlag war ein Signal an die afghanische Regierung und auch an die ZivilbevÃ¶lkerung: Niemand kann sich in Afghanistan sicher fÃ¼hlen. Zu keiner Zeit.

9. Wir sind verdammt nochmal fÃ¼r diesen Krieg mitverantwortlich

Manche in Deutschland tun so, als ginge sie der Krieg in Afghanistan nichts an. Das ist, vorsichtig ausgedrÃ¼ckt, ziemlich verantwortungslos.

Die Bundeswehr ist eine Parlamentsarmee. Sie wurde nicht von einer Kanzlerin oder von kriegslÃ¼sternen GenerÃ¤len in den Kampf geschickt, sondern vom deutschen Bundestag. Jeder, der seit 1998 die Union, die FDP, die SPD oder die GrÃ¼nen gewÃ¤hlt hat, war mit seiner Stimme mitverantwortlich fÃ¼r alles, was deutsche Truppen unter dem Isaf-Banner an guten und schlechten Dingen in Afghanistan geleistet haben.

Und das sind fast alle Deutschen, die seitdem wÃ¤hlen gegangen sind.

TatsÃ¤chlich haben deutsche Soldaten wichtige Hilfe geleistet: Sie haben Bildungsprojekte ermÃ¶glicht, BrÃ¼cken gebaut und afghanische SicherheitskrÃ¤fte ausgebildet.

Aber genauso gut sind wir alle auch fÃ¼r das Schlechte mitverantwortlich, was nach dem womÃ¶glich voreiligen Abzug der Truppen entstanden ist. Wir kÃ¶nnen als Deutsche nicht die Amerikaner fÃ¼r den Aufstieg des IS verantwortlich machen, aber gleichzeitig unsere Verantwortung fÃ¼r das Chaos in Afghanistan klein reden.

Wir haben eine moralische Verpflichtung, den Kriegsopfern aus Afghanistan zu helfen. Das sollte sich vor allem einmal unser Innenminister klar machen.

FlÃ¼chtlingskrise: Helft den Helfern!

Die FlÃ¼chtlingskrise bewegt die Deutschen wie kein anderes Thema. Viele blicken fassungslos auf das, was sich an Europas Grenzen abspielt. Auf das Leiden und die NÃ¶te der Hilfesuchenden.

(ben)
TITLE: 9 Fakten, die jeder kennen sollte, der Abschiebungen nach Afghanistan fÃ¼r eine gute Idee hÃ¤lt

SUMMARY:
The unions watchdog says police raids on two Australian Workers Union offices were necessary because it had been tipped off documents were at risk of being tampered with or destroyed.
The Registered Organisations Commission on Wednesday night also insisted the raids were not aimed at Labor leader Bill Shorten.
Mr Enright said the only people aware of the searches about to be conducted were a small team in the ROC and the AFP.
"There is no person in this country more disappointed than me when I heard that," Mr Enright said.
"This investigation is not into Mr Shorten - it is into the AWU."
TEXT:
Labor leader Bill Shorten has labelled the raids on the AWU offices as a smear campaign.

The unions watchdog says police raids on two Australian Workers Union offices were necessary because it had been tipped off documents were at risk of being tampered with or destroyed.

The Registered Organisations Commission on Wednesday night also insisted the raids were not aimed at Labor leader Bill Shorten.

Commissioner Mark Bielecki told a Senate hearing a magistrate had accepted the commission's argument there was a "very reasonable prospect" of evidence being tampered with, concealed or destroyed.

Commission executive manager Chris Enright said the information had come to a member of staff "from a caller", but he declined to say whether it was anonymous.

.@billshortenmp: The use of 30 AFP officers to collect documents is an amazing waste of money. MORE: https://t.co/WL5pMlgwuD pic.twitter.com/m6FU0aZYUf â€” Sky News Australia (@SkyNewsAust) October 24, 2017

Mr Bielecki said the Australian Federal Police were involved because only an AFP officer could serve a warrant under the ROC's laws.

The ROC had asked the union in August for the relevant documents to be provided voluntarily, but the union through its lawyers had declined, he said.

"Had they voluntarily complied with the request and gave us that information it may have not progressed to an inquiry or an investigation under the Act," he said.

DanWaltonAWU says @AusFedPolice raids on @AWUnion offices in Sydney and Melbourne are an abuse of power 24 Oct - 2017 pic.twitter.com/dlwm1A2oQi â€” Sir Clyde Of Nob (@nobby15) October 24, 2017

The matter related to a total of $200,000 in donations by the AWU.

"The ROC is focused on looking after the interests of members and ensuring their money is spent within a way that is properly authorised and complies with rules of the organisation and complies with the Act," the commissioner said.

Mr Enright said the only people aware of the searches about to be conducted were a small team in the ROC and the AFP.

"We didn't brief anyone else," he said.

.@BOConnorMP says it's clear the 'grubby' PM is using the power of the state to attack his political opponents' MORE https://t.co/WPEWhnwuRG pic.twitter.com/zrKHD0XeEy â€” Sky News Australia (@SkyNewsAust) October 24, 2017

At 4.30pm Mr Enright tried to phone the AWU national secretary but did not get through.

He then spoke to the Victorian secretary and told him the ROC was intending to conduct the search in a "very low key way".

However the secretary then indicated media crews were already outside.

"There is no person in this country more disappointed than me when I heard that," Mr Enright said.

At 4.33pm he rang a senior adviser in the minister's office and informed him the searches were under way.

Bill Shorten slams Malcolm Turnbull as a 'grubby" PM over union raids https://t.co/TNgxWLheGi pic.twitter.com/dh7j531ETX â€” HuffPost Australia (@HuffPostAU) October 25, 2017

Asked whether the ROC could have leaked to the media, Mr Enright said the ROC's media manager, who had only been in the role for two weeks, had told him he did not know anyone in the minister's office and had nor engaged with anyone in the minister's office.

Asked whether he believed the ROC had been politicised, Mr Bielecki said: "Not at all."

"This investigation is not into Mr Shorten - it is into the AWU."

The ROC currently has five investigations and one inquiry under way.

As well it is considering information from the Heydon royal commission and 18 whistleblower disclosures.
TITLE: Raids On Australian Workers Union 'Necessary And Not Political'

SUMMARY:
Norwegian-born actress Natassia Malthe has accused Harvey Weinstein of raping her.
Malthe claims the disgraced film mogul forced himself on her at a hotel room in London in 2008 after the Bafta awards ceremony.
The 43-year-old said she had met Weinstein at the awards earlier and that he had asked which hotel she was staying at.
I believe I dissociated during the time he was having sex with me.
Mike Blake / Reuters Harvey Weinstein has denied having non-consensual sex with anyone
TEXT:
Norwegian-born actress Natassia Malthe has accused Harvey Weinstein of raping her. Malthe claims the disgraced film mogul forced himself on her at a hotel room in London in 2008 after the Bafta awards ceremony. The 43-year-old said she had met Weinstein at the awards earlier and that he had asked which hotel she was staying at. Later that night as she was preparing to sleep, he allegedly began pounding on her door.

Brendan McDermid / Reuters Natassia Malthe, with lawyer Gloria Allred during a news conference in New York City

During a press conference in New York on Wednesday with attorney Gloria Allred, Malthe said she had felt â€œhorrifiedâ€ that other members of the film industry also staying at the Sanderson Hotel would hear the commotion, and let him in. She then claimed Weinstein removed his trousers and began masturbating in front of her and talking about how A-list celebrities achieved their fame by having sex with him. She added: â€œHe forced himself on me. It was not consensual. He did not use a condom; however he did not ejaculate inside me. I was completely grossed out. I believe I dissociated during the time he was having sex with me. I played dead. Afterwards I lay there in complete disgust.â€

Stephen Hird / Reuters Malthe at the Baftas in London in 2008

Allred, who is representing several of the alleged victims including Heather Kerr, Mimi Haleyi and Louisette Geiss, said: â€œItâ€™s time for The Weinstein Company to put their money where their mouths are.â€ Malthe alleged she received a script the next day, before returning to LA where she was given the impression she had landed a role in the Weinstein-produced film Nine, which would go on to star Daniel Day-Lewis, Penelope Cruz, Nicole Kidman and Judi Dench. She arranged to meet Weinstein at his hotel in LA to discuss the role, having been reassured an assistant would be present.

Brendan McDermid / Reuters Malthe said her 'dreams had been shattered'

Upon arrival, Malthe says she found Weinstein with a woman who â€œtook off her clothes and began giving Harvey a blow jobâ€. She alleges Weinstein asked her to join the pair in a threesome and when she refused he called her an â€œungrateful cunt.â€ â€œI felt my dreams had been shattered,â€ Malthe said. She added: â€œI had experienced sexual harassment from other powerful men in Hollywood but my experiences with Harvey were the worst.â€ Allred said Malthe is â€œconsideringâ€ whether to make a report to the police over the allegation.

Mike Blake / Reuters Harvey Weinstein has denied having non-consensual sex with anyone
TITLE: Actress Natassia Malthe Accuses Harvey Weinstein Of Raping Her In London Hotel After Bafta Awards

Weâ€™re hearing that Khloe Kardashian and boyfriend Tristan Thompson are reportedly expecting a baby boy early next year, according to multiple outlets.
Even though the Kardashians have strangely stayed quiet on the issue, details about sisters Khloe, Kylie and Kimâ€™s apparent pregnancy trifecta continue to make the internet rounds.
As itâ€™s been said before, the devil works hard but Kris Jenner works harder.
Kardashianâ€™s pregnancy was confirmed in September just days after reports claimed that 20-year-old Kylie was pregnant with rapper Travis Scottâ€™s child.

TEXT:
Weâ€™re hearing that Khloe Kardashian and boyfriend Tristan Thompson are reportedly expecting a baby boy early next year, according to multiple outlets.

Cue brainstorming session for boy names beginning with K. Kenan? Kermit? Kanye II? We donâ€™t know.

Even though the Kardashians have strangely stayed quiet on the issue, details about sisters Khloe, Kylie and Kimâ€™s apparent pregnancy trifecta continue to make the internet rounds. As itâ€™s been said before, the devil works hard but Kris Jenner works harder.

Kardashianâ€™s pregnancy was confirmed in September just days after reports claimed that 20-year-old Kylie was pregnant with rapper Travis Scottâ€™s child. At the time, Khloe was said to be three months pregnant after conceiving naturally. Sister Kim is also currently expecting her third child via surrogate.

This will be Khloeâ€™s first child, while Thompson already has a 10-month-old son from a previous relationship with ex-girlfriend Jordan Craig.

A post shared by KhloÃ© (@khloekardashian) on Oct 16, 2017 at 9:12am PDT

A post shared by KhloÃ© (@khloekardashian) on Oct 6, 2017 at 6:25am PDT

Of course, momager Kris Jenner has come closest among the family to outright confirm that Khloe is pregnant, telling Entertainment Tonight that she is â€œover the moonâ€ about her daughter being in a great place in here life.

â€œWe love Tristan so much, and sheâ€™s so happy, and sheâ€™s been through so much,â€ Jenner said. â€œJust seeing her be able to do something so creative with [her denim line] Good American â€• thatâ€™s her passion. On top of it, to be in such a great place in her personal life is amazing. Sheâ€™s really happy.â€

Khloe, meanwhile, has been laying low save for promoting her Good American clothing line here, and a new lip kit collaboration with sister Kylie there. The two appeared on camera together for a video released on Tuesday after news of their pregnancies broke.

Rocking matching blond tresses, the sisters experiment with the new products in the video, while joking about having â€œso many babies.â€

Itâ€™s almost like theyâ€™re trying to tell us something.
TITLE: Khloe Kardashian Is Reportedly Bringing A Baby Boy Into The World

SUMMARY:
In 1922, Albert Einstein scribbled down words of wisdom on a piece of paper he left with a Tokyo bellboy instead of a tip.
"Maybe if you're lucky those notes will become much more valuable than just a regular tip," the physicist told the bellboy, according to the seller, who has not been identified.
While less kind observers may accuse the man who brought us the theory of relativity of being stingy with the tip, Einstein turned out to be right.
The note fetched $1.56 million (USD) when it came up for auction in Jerusalem, Israel, on Tuesday.
Another Einstein note written at the same time, reading "where there's a will, there's a way," went for $240,000.
TEXT:
In 1922, Albert Einstein scribbled down words of wisdom on a piece of paper he left with a Tokyo bellboy instead of a tip.

"A quiet and modest life brings more joy than a pursuit of success bound with constant unrest," the note, which was written while the physicist was on a lecture tour in Japan, says in German.

"Maybe if you're lucky those notes will become much more valuable than just a regular tip," the physicist told the bellboy, according to the seller, who has not been identified. While less kind observers may accuse the man who brought us the theory of relativity of being stingy with the tip, Einstein turned out to be right.

The note fetched $1.56 million (USD) when it came up for auction in Jerusalem, Israel, on Tuesday. Another Einstein note written at the same time, reading "where there's a will, there's a way," went for $240,000. A spokesman for Winner's Auctions and Exhibitions told the Jerusalem Post that the letters came to them directly from a great-nephew of the bellboy.

There is a clear irony in Einstein's handwritten thoughts on simplicity and modesty over the pursuit of wealth are being sold for such an enormous amount. Something that wasn't missed on Twitter:
TITLE: Note Given By Albert Einstein In Lieu Of Tip Sells For More Than $2 Million

De acuerdo al reporte del Coneval de 2014 existen en MÃ©xico aproximadamente 55 300 000 personas que viven en pobreza, le pongo todos los CEROS para causar precisamente ese reacciÃ³n en ti lector. Y algo aÃºn mÃ¡s grave, de esos, poco mÃ¡s de 11.4 millones viven en pobreza extrema.

No sÃ© a ti, pero a mÃ­ estos datos me parecen escalofriantes.

En una naciÃ³n plagada por la corrupciÃ³n a todos los niveles polÃ­ticos, ya es hora de que el sector privado tome parte de la responsabilidad y contribuya a reducir los niveles de pobreza que existen en nuestro paÃ­s, el resto de LatinoamÃ©rica, Ãfrica y partes de Asia.

Y quiÃ©n mejor que los emprendedores para generar un cambio social. El principal motor econÃ³mico en MÃ©xico son las MIPYMES, aproximadamente el 80% del total de empresas segÃºn datos del INEGI del 2015. Somos las micro y pequeÃ±as empresas las que generamos el mayor nÃºmero de empleos en el paÃ­s. Con esta oportunidad tan al alcance para transformar a la sociedad, es casi una obligaciÃ³n, responsabilidad fundamental, el que los emprendedores se planteen como pueden generar impacto social.

Somos las micro y pequeÃ±as empresas las que generamos el mayor nÃºmero de empleos en el paÃ­s .

Cambios bÃ¡sicos como incluir en las polÃ­ticas beneficios mÃ¡s allÃ¡ de la ley para los empleados, como reparticiÃ³n de utilidades, fondo de ahorro, polÃ­ticas que disminuyan la huella de carbÃ³n de tu operaciÃ³n. Hay tanto que los emprendedores de hoy podemos hacer para lograr cambios, empezando con los mÃ¡s cercanos a nosotros: empleados, proveedores, el medio ambiente, tu comunidad.

Es precisamente esa injusticia social la que hace hervir la sangre, la que nos inspira a mi hermano Constantino y a mÃ­ a contribuir con lo que nos corresponde, empezando en casa. Somos orgullosamente yucatecos, oriundos de la Blanca MÃ©rida, donde dormir en hamaca es parte de la vida cotidiana y si tienes suerte, jamÃ¡s en tu vida tendrÃ¡s que dormir en una cama.

IniciÃ© mi carrera profesional en banca de inversiÃ³n, trabajando en Nueva York, y pronto empecÃ© a ayudar a mi hermano en su start-up de hamacas. Nos hicimos socios, dejÃ© mi trabajo de banquera y tuve la suerte de encontrar un proyecto que me apasiona. Una de las cosas que mÃ¡s me enorgullecen de nuestro trabajo es que, siendo los dos gen-X, somos poco tecnolÃ³gicos, solo lo bÃ¡sico. AsÃ­ que emprendedores como los que estÃ¡n de moda el dÃ­a de hoy no serÃ­amos nosotros.

Sin embargo, empezamos en nuestra comunidad, reconociendo el valor histÃ³rico-cultural y tradiciÃ³n ancestral de las hamacas mayas que tanto adoramos los yucatecos. Como es fÃ¡cil de imaginar, las hamacas las urden las poblaciones mÃ¡s rezagadas de la PenÃ­nsula de YucatÃ¡n. Desde el inicio, reconocimos que nuestro proyecto era de una envergadura mayor.

No solamente hemos logrado convertirnos en el mayor exportador de hamacas en MÃ©xico, llevÃ¡ndolas al mundo entero, sino que mÃ¡s importante aÃºn, hemos logrado un impacto social en las comunidades donde viven nuestras urdidoras.

Promovemos la equidad de gÃ©nero y disminuimos los niveles de pobreza generando fuentes de ingreso para aproximadamente 900 familias de la regiÃ³n. El modelo de negocio fue concebido considerando como eje principal el generar un cambio social desde el inicio, y es este principio Ã©tico fundamental que creemos firmemente debe estar en la conciencia de todo emprendedor.

Los objetivos de desarrollo del milenio establecidos por la ONU son audaces, pero alcanzables. Todo aquel que presuma ser emprendedor debe hacerse el dÃ­a de hoy las preguntas: Â¿QuÃ© estÃ¡ haciendo mi modelo de negocio por promover impacto social? Â¿Estoy ayudando a contribuir a alguna de las metas del milenio?

Tenemos que cambiar la visiÃ³n tradicional que los negocios estÃ¡n para generar utilidades. Es vital que las empresas deban generar utilidades para ser sostenibles, pero tambiÃ©n pueden ser transformadores de la sociedad. Donde no solo se procure conservar el medio ambiente, sino que ademÃ¡s incluya pagarle a los trabajadores con dignidad y Â¿por quÃ© no? Asignar una parte de las utilidades como donativo a una ONG.

La filantropÃ­a y los negocios sociales han cobrado gran auge y se ha notado un cambio en la actitud de los empresarios, pero sobre todo en los consumidores principalmente en paÃ­ses como EU y en los de Europa. Esta es la nueva visiÃ³n que define realmente el verdadero Ã©xito, trasciende los lÃ­mites econÃ³micos, trae una perspectiva mucho mÃ¡s profunda y con beneficios que puede sentar las bases para realmente sacar a nuestro paÃ­s y a muchos otros de la desigualdad y rezago social.

Emprendedor, te digo hoy, el cambio estÃ¡ en tus manos.

En esta ocasiÃ³n se analizarÃ¡ cÃ³mo tanto mujeres como hombres lÃ­deres pueden â€Ÿdar rienda suelta a su liderazgo", ya sea en el entorno corporativo, sin fines de lucro, empresarial, tecnolÃ³gico, acadÃ©mico, artÃ­stico, deportivo, de servicios y polÃ­tico. TEXT:
Kellogg's sind bei Kindern auch wegen ihrer bunten Verpackung sehr beliebt

Ein Comic auf einer Kellogg's Schachtel sorgt jetzt fÃ¼r Ã„rger

Wie die Cornflakes-Firma auf die VorwÃ¼rfe reagiert, seht ihr im Video oben

Die Produkte der MÃ¼sli-Firma Kelloggâ€™s sind bei Kindern nicht nur wegen ihrer verschiedenen Cornflakes beliebt, sondern auch wegen ihrer bunten Verpackungen. Bei der neuen Verpackung der Sorte Corn Pops sorgt jetzt ein Detail fÃ¼r Aufsehen.

Darauf ist ein Comic abgedruckt, der Corn Pops als Figuren in einem Einkaufszentrum zeigt. So schiebt zum Beispiel ein Corn Pop seinen vollen Einkaufswagen, ein anderes fÃ¤hrt Skateboard. Die meisten dargestellten Corn Pops gehen in der Mall verschiedenen FreizeitbeschÃ¤ftigungen nach.

"Das lehrt Kindern Rassismus"

Bei all diesen Figuren handelt es sich um helle Corn Pops. Aber es gibt auch ein einziges dunkles Corn Pop. Den Hausmeister der Mall, der gerade den Boden putzt. Und das ist dem amerikanischen Fantasy-Autor Saladin Ahmed ein Dorn im Auge.

Auf Twitter schreibt er an Kelloggâ€™s: "Warum ist buchstÃ¤blich das einzige braune Corn Pop auf der ganzen Verpackung der Hausmeister? Das lehrt Kindern Rassismus."

SUMMARY:
One of the hardest parts of my childhood was seeing Rosa left out of social events," Jonathon Hopkirk, founder of Dance For Abilities told HuffPost Australia.
His sister Rosa has Down Syndrome.
Hopkirks aim was to create social events that mirrored the types of functions and settings we all enjoy and take for granted.
Guests have the opportunity to dance and socialise as well as participate in activities like getting their hair and makeup done at DFA events.
We want to offer free social events to the intellectually disabled community every two months.
TEXT:
Think back to when you were a teen. Going to the formal or a weekend dance party was always filled with such a mix of emotions -- excitement, anticipation and maybe a bit of nerves. But the events themselves were a given. They are a rite of passage for any kid growing up.

Though that's not always the case for intellectually disabled young people, and indeed all intellectually disabled people in Australia. It's that very problem from which Dance For Abilities was born.

"Rosa is my older sister, and we also have two older brothers. One of the hardest parts of my childhood was seeing Rosa left out of social events," Jonathon Hopkirk, founder of Dance For Abilities told HuffPost Australia.

His sister Rosa has Down Syndrome.

"This really affected me, as I knew I couldn't always be her resolution. I watched her spend time alone in the school playground to the point it just tore my heart out," he said.

"As we grew older and entered adulthood I would see her miss out on nights out and trips away with buddies for NYE and summer getaways. My family started to take her along to dance parties, where I'd DJ, and we realised how much she loved it.

"It also opened our eyes to see the level of warmth and encouragement she received from other people at the events for being there despite her having Down Syndrome," Hopkirk said.

Hopkirk with his sister Rosa at the latest DFA event.

Witnessing Rosa's joy sparked an idea.

"All of this resonated with me, so I used the emotional fuel built up from our childhood mixed with the desire to change the game for people like Rosa all over the world, and my first-hand experience of seeing what a positive impact being out had on Rosa and everyone else and created Dance For Abilities."

"DFA is free social dance night extravaganza exclusively for people with intellectual disabilities where they are every bit included but also help design and run it," Hopkirk said.

Hopkirks aim was to create social events that mirrored the types of functions and settings we all enjoy and take for granted.

"Social opportunities logistically can be limited for people with intellectual disabilities and funding also presents an issue. There are some incredible groups and individuals doing amazing things week in week out to offer opportunities to this community."

"However, my vision was to host events for people with intellectual disabilities in the same venues that we 'all' like to attend with the same frills that we 'all' take for granted when socializing, these guys deserve that," Hopkirk said.

Guests have the opportunity to dance and socialise as well as participate in activities like getting their hair and makeup done at DFA events.

"I know Rosa loves all the lights, glitz and the glam of nightclubs however seldom has the opportunity to enjoy them as logistically there are a lot of challenges to enable this. DFA offers this opportunity to people in Rosa's shoes who have the desire for dance parties and social events and helps remove those logistical speed bumps to ensure ease of accessibility.

"It also allows the interaction between those who get involved offering their services and those that have a disability which helps to build a positive familiarity in an often, segregated society."

Dance for Abilities put on an event last month at Sydney's Ravesis hotel.

"The event was incredibly well received by all who attended. It was amazing to have family members and support workers there enjoying the night as well. We had dance competitions with some great prizes, all of which were kindly donated by friends and family.

"There was a candy bar, photo booth, as well a pamper booth with hair and makeup artists. Never have I been in a room filled with so much love and joy. From the night stemmed the hashtag #CountTheSmiles as every photo is just filled with laughter and smiles all round," Hopkirk said.

As for what Hopkirk hopes to achieve with Dance for Abilities? It's simple. Inclusion.

"Our biggest aim is fun and inclusion. We want to offer free social events to the intellectually disabled community every two months. We aim to launch in other cities nationally with the ultimate goal of spreading globally. We want to raise awareness about the positive impact diversity such as intellectual disability has on a community and the world at large," he said.

"It's important for the community to see people from this group enjoying themselves in settings that we all like to attend. DFA is also looking at ways of supporting carers with a 'caring for carers' movement and offering support in things like transitioning to the workplace and digital education for people with intellectual disabilities.

"It is all about inclusion and creating opportunity and I have a strong feeling this will extend beyond the dance floor in due course."
TITLE: Dance For Abilities: Creating A Social Scene For Australia's Disabled Youth

La neuroscience quant Ã  elle aborde la rencontre en adoptant sa stratÃ©gie traditionnelle; elle dissÃ¨que la croyance pour en isoler les diffÃ©rentes formes et soumet chacune d'elles au gril de l'expÃ©rimentation.

PremiÃ¨re constatation: aucun de nos sens ne fournit une reprÃ©sentation infaillible de la rÃ©alitÃ©; ce que nous percevons est soumis Ã  des illusions, des distorsions, et le souvenir que nous en gardons peut Ãªtre transformÃ©, simplifiÃ© ou perdu. Elle fixe qu'une perception, ou une information transmise sont vraies, en faisant l'Ã©conomie de sa remise en question. Elle nous Ã©pargne des efforts et elle participe ainsi Ã  la bonne gestion de nos "forces neuronales" et donc Ã  notre bien-Ãªtre mental. GÃ©nÃ©ralement, cette forme de croyance n'a de consÃ©quences que sur ce que l'on appelle la vie de tous les jours. Mais lorsqu'un large groupe d'individus adopte une croyance Ã  propos des mÃªmes faits, son influence sur des populations entiÃ¨res peut Ãªtre importante, l'intÃ©rÃªt rÃ©cent pour les "fake news" le prouve. Certaines croyances sont collectives, sans Ãªtre le rÃ©sultat d'une diffusion "virale" d'informations ponctuelles. Il s'agit des croyances qui ont Ã©mergÃ© dans une communautÃ© pour rÃ©soudre un large Ã©ventail de doutes; elles s'y sont implantÃ©es pour former un ensemble partagÃ© et cohÃ©rent. On entre lÃ  dans le domaine des "grandes croyances", parmi lesquelles la croyance en Dieu qui libÃ¨re de maniÃ¨re universelle et efficace de nombreux doutes existentiels. Et cette croyance religieuse a Ã©tÃ© sondÃ©e par l'expÃ©rimentation neuroscientifique.

Des Ã©tudes ont comparÃ© l'activitÃ© cÃ©rÃ©brale d'individus croyants et non croyants; d'autres Ã©tudes ont scrutÃ© l'activitÃ© cÃ©rÃ©brale au cours de pratiques religieuses â€”la priÃ¨re, la mÃ©ditationâ€” ou en bloquant par des champs magnÃ©tiques l'activitÃ© de certaines rÃ©gions cÃ©rÃ©brales pour tester leur rÃ´le dans la croyance. De ces expÃ©riences, il ressort que la croyance pourrait mettre en jeu certaines rÃ©gions cÃ©rÃ©brales particuliÃ¨res, ou plus exactement certains rÃ©seaux corticaux. TEXT:
Americaâ€™s sweetheart no more, Taylor Swiftâ€™s music persona morphs into what appears to be an android warrior to fight the forces of evil in a stunning teaser for a music video from her new album.

In the spiky, sci-fi scenes for â€œ ... Are You Ready for It?â€ â€” posted on Swiftâ€™s Instagram Monday â€” the singer appears to be transformed into a powerful cyborg (Ã  la the Terminator) and takes on futuristic villains with lightning bolts and a thrumming beat. She wears a knockout nude cyborg bodysuit nearly identical to the one donned by Scarlett Johansson in last yearâ€™s film â€œGhost in the Shell.â€

A post shared by Taylor Swift (@taylorswift) on Oct 23, 2017 at 7:02am PDT

A post shared by Japanese SwiftieğŸ‡¯ğŸ‡µ (@ever.been_mine.07) on Oct 23, 2017 at 7:41am PDT

The full video premieres Thursday. The â€œ ... Are You Ready For It?â€ track, part of Swiftâ€™s sixth album, â€œReputationâ€ (due out Nov. 10), was released online early last month. â€œGorgeous,â€ the third song released from the album, dropped last week.

The edgy, dark video is another step in the singerâ€™s transformation that Swift has been boasting about. â€œIâ€™m sorry, the old Taylor Swift canâ€™t come to the phone right now,â€ she intones in the lead track from the album, â€œLook What You Made Me Doâ€ (and appears as a zombie in that video). â€œWhy? Oh, â€™cause sheâ€™s dead!â€

Beyond the apparent references to â€œGhost in the Shellâ€ and the moody rain-soaked streets of â€œBlade Runnerâ€ in the new video, fans also spotted several similarities to Swiftâ€™s video for her 2014 single â€œOut of the Woods.â€ Swift said then that the song was about the anxiety she grapples with in a relationship.

'Out of the Woods' and 'Ready For It' music video parallels. #ReadyForItMusicVideo pic.twitter.com/sspJvj3W1q â€” Taylor Swift Updates (@TSwiftPR) October 23, 2017

One of the more mysterious scenes shows a lightning bolt apparently striking Swift with the words: â€œTheyâ€™re burning all the witches.â€

Itâ€™s hard to know how well the video will work with the songâ€™s lyrics, which fans believe are about Swiftâ€™s current beau, British actor Joe Alwyn.

â€œKnew he was a killer/first time that I saw him/Wonder how many girls he had loved and left haunted./But if heâ€™s a ghost then/I can be a phantom/Holding him for ransom,â€ Swift sings. â€œAre you ready for it?/Baby, let the games begin/The games begin.â€



In an interesting case of art and celebrity intertwining, the actress who plays the perfectly coifed and tough-as-nails 1950s-style housewife villain in the new â€œBlade Runner 2049â€ says she was inspired in part by Swift.

â€œI looked at big celebrities, big singers, who are younger girls, like Taylor Swift or Selena Gomez,â€ Sylvia Hoeks told Bustle.
TITLE: Taylor Swift Meets 'Blade Runner' In Steamy 'Ready For It' Video Teaser

Pourtant, il faudra finalement accepter ce qui vous semble inacceptable : si vous faites Ã§a, vous Ãªtes un gros rapiat.

Des petites choses du quotidien qui dÃ©paysent naÃ¯vement et avec lÃ©gÃ¨retÃ©, il y en a un tas. En tout cas.

Par ailleurs, le moment oÃ¹ vous direz Â« en tout cas Â», comme pour clore une conversation dans laquelle vous auriez jadis utilisÃ© un Â« non, mais peu importe, quoi ! Â» arrivera, lui aussi, et bien vite.

En France, on vous rabÃ¢chera les oreilles sur ce soi-disant Â« accent canadien Â» que vous aurez attrapÃ©, et vous rÃ©pondrez, las qu'Ã  la rigueur, il s'agisse d'un accent quÃ©bÃ©cois. Puis, vin aidant, vous vous embarquerez dans un monologue enflammÃ© aux arguments quasi souverainistes pour expliquer Ã  ces FranÃ§ais ignares la diffÃ©rence entre le QuÃ©bec et le reste du Canada... avant d'oublier que vous aussi, il n'y a pas si longtemps, vous ne faisiez pas rÃ©ellement la diffÃ©rence.

Quant Ã  ici, vous serez toujours, un peu, le Â« FranÃ§ais de service Â». Parfois, c'est insultant, parfois Ã§a sonne comme des mots d'amour. Il ne tiendra qu'Ã  vous.

Mais petit conseil, immigrer au QuÃ©bec, c'est comme immigrer n'importe oÃ¹ ; on a tout Ã  (rÃ©)apprendre. Rien n'est acquis, et notre faÃ§on de faire en France n'a pas plus de valeur ici qu'ailleurs. SUMMARY:
"If you don't ask, you don't get," said Halabi, whose company helps people get better telecoms rates.
He said telecoms providers are, however, also eager for new customers, so it's a good idea to push for the best deal possible when signing up.
He said you can often extend promotion pricing from six months to a year, and get better than the advertised rates.
'You have to do the footwork'With more than 500 internet service providers in Canada, the variance on pricing can go even further though.
Sousa said that he's been able to get his bill down close to the competition, but it takes work.
TEXT:
CALGARY â€” When Kevin Sousa's cable company botched his service repairs for a third time, he decided it was time to shop around for a better provider.

But even before starting his search, he knew he had few companies to turn to, especially if he wanted to keep his services bundled in a single convenient package.

"It's terrible, we have so few options," said Sousa. "For me to go somewhere else, I only have the option of Bell really, because if I go anywhere else I have to break it all up."

Watch: Canadians are getting the worst deal of anyone on wireless

Canadians know the conundrum well, but industry watchers say that consumers can at least lower their bills by looking at the growing number of alternatives or pushing back on the big telecoms.

"Look at your options, do your research, and try a smaller player like Distributel or TekSavvy, that don't have as much of a market share, but are able to give you a better deal," said Katy Anderson, a digital rights specialist at OpenMedia.

She said smaller internet players are adding some competition to the industry, but that prices are still inflated and alternative providers are often not available in more rural parts of the country.

The CRTC has been trying to foster more competition, including declaring 50 mbps internet a basic service, and requiring the major telecoms to sell space on even their fastest fibre optic lines, but Anderson said the federal government still needs to create its own broadband strategy for the country.

'If you don't ask, you don't get'

Mohammed Halabi, director of MyBillsAreHigh, says part of the problem is too few people are pushing against the prices being offered by the big telecoms.

"If you don't ask, you don't get," said Halabi, whose company helps people get better telecoms rates.

He said it's unfortunate that there's so little clarity on pricing and other issues in the telecoms industry, but consumers do have options.

"Customers have been put in that position, so you have to go in there and ask, and don't hesitate to switch your services if you're not getting a good deal from your provider."

Politeness goes a long way

He said it's important not to be outrageous in what you're asking though, and to keep in mind that loyalty â€” and politeness â€” does help as you negotiate through escalating levels of customer service staff.

"Tenure does go a long way in negotiations, 100 per cent. One of the most important factors actually."

He said telecoms providers are, however, also eager for new customers, so it's a good idea to push for the best deal possible when signing up. He said you can often extend promotion pricing from six months to a year, and get better than the advertised rates.

Unbundle to save money

Halabi also said that unless you really need the trio of cable, phone line, and internet, you can generally get a better deal by splitting up the services and pushing for the best rate individually on each.

As to knowing how far you can push, Halabi said the cheaper upstart options provide a good reference point on pricing.

"Usually you can get something close to that price point with the big three, after some negotiating. After all, they're selling the service to that company."

He pointed to a current Rogers promotion for a 150 mbps speed hookup at $80 a month, down from $100, but said he's been able to get it for new clients at $60, which is about the same rate that TekSavvy's pricing for that speed starts.

'You have to do the footwork'

With more than 500 internet service providers in Canada, the variance on pricing can go even further though. The CRTC says that for a basic five mbps download internet connection, some providers charge as much as $73 a month for the service in Vancouver and Winnipeg and $85 in St. John's, while competitors offer the same speed for as low as $25 a month in those cities.

Sousa said that he's been able to get his bill down close to the competition, but it takes work.

"You have to do the footwork. I call it a dance," said Sousa.

"You can eventually get it down to about the same price as those other services, but you've got to fight for that kind of stuff."

Also on HuffPost:
TITLE: Yes, You Can Lower Your Telecom Bill. Here's How.

SUMMARY:
Prime Minister Malcolm Turnbull was forced to return serve on so many questions about Michaelia Cash on Thursday, you'd be forgiven for mistaking Question Time for a tennis match.
And who else was present, including but not limited to, MPs and Members of the Prime Minister's office?"
"Does [Turnbull] expect Australians to believe the Employment Minister's office watched the Minister misleads the Senate five times yesterday but didn't say a thing?"
"The honourable Member knows very well that the Minister [Cash] is accountable.
Prime Minister Malcolm Turnbull during question time at Parliament House in Canberra on Thursday 26 October 2017.
TEXT:
It's been a tough day at the office for the Prime Minister.

Prime Minister Malcolm Turnbull was forced to return serve on so many questions about Michaelia Cash on Thursday, you'd be forgiven for mistaking Question Time for a tennis match.

Labor repeatedly put the PM on the spot, calling for employment minister Michaelia Cash's resignation in light of her stunning admission on Wednesday night that her staff tipped off journalists ahead of raids by the Australian Federal Police (AFP) on the Australian Workers' Union (AWU) headquarters in Sydney and Melbourne.

And while five was the magic number of questions related to the incident faced by Cash on Wednesday night, on Thursday Turnbull was fronted on six separate occasions by Labor Party MPs looking for answers about how the parliament may have been misled.

First onto the floor of the House of Representatives was Deputy Leader of the Opposition Tanya Plibersek, wanting to know whether Cash and her staffer -- who was responsible for the leak and has now resigned -- attended a question time meeting on Wednesday along with other Liberal Party Members.

"Can the Prime Minister confirm the Employment Minister and her senior media adviser, who has now resigned for leaking details of imminent rates to the media, attended that Question Time meeting yesterday?," she asked.

"At what time did it take place? Did it take place in his personal office? And who else was present, including but not limited to, MPs and Members of the Prime Minister's office?"

Jesus that Coalition frontbench looks deflated #qt #auspol â€” Adam Gartrell (@adamgartrell) October 26, 2017

But Turnbull moved quickly with his return shot by continuing to defend Cash's comments in Wednesday night's Senate Estimates hearing.

"Well, Mr Speaker, the Deputy Leader of the Opposition is not going to do a very good impression of Perry Mason today," he said.

"She may bark on a fishing expedition, but, Mr Speaker, I repeat what I said yesterday -- that the Minister for Employment is sure she did not advise any journalists about the raid and that is precisely what she has said in the Senate during Estimates."

But the barrage from the Opposition didn't stop there. In between discussions about energy prices, the Shadow Minister for Employment and Workplace Relations Brendan O'Connor was next to serve up another quick hit aimed at the Prime Minister's end of the room.

"Does [Turnbull] expect Australians to believe the Employment Minister's office watched the Minister misleads the Senate five times yesterday but didn't say a thing?" he said.

"The senior adviser, who has now resigned, attended the briefing with the Minister that said nothing, and the adviser then heard the Prime Minister asked twice about the matter during Question Time but still did nothing."

Turnbull doesn't want to come within cooee of giving any detail about what happened at his meeting with Cash and Rogue Staffer #qt â€” Tim Watts MP (@TimWattsMP) October 26, 2017

And the Prime Minister was quick to respond once more with a shot of his own about Opposition Leader Bill Shorten and Labor questioning the integrity of the Australian Federal Police (AFP).

"The media adviser concerned has properly resigned after a very, very wrong, improper act of indiscretion, and he was wrong to do what he has admitted to but he was right to resign," he said.

"The Leader of the Opposition should reflect on the fact that the Australian Federal Police, the men and women of that force, keep us safe. They are independent, they are upholders of the rule of law, and it's about time Labor did, too."

From there, Independent Member Bob Katter managed to get a question in and there was some more talk about energy policy -- but if you thought then that the swinging shots from the Opposition towards the Prime Minister were over, you'd be wrong.

Labor asking if PM Turnbull if he "didn't think to ask" that Cash's office had leaked, or had he been advised it was safer to not ask #qt â€” Alice Workman (@workmanalice) October 26, 2017

From there, Labor's Tony Burke was next to lob another loaded question in Turnbull's direction, asking whether the Prime Minister expected the Australian public, in light of a Buzzfeed report on the matter, to believe he had not checked with Cash about the possibility that the leak had come from her office.

And still the Prime Minister managed to deflect any damage, repeating what he had already said twice before and diverting the direction of the question time conversation back onto his opponents.

"The Minister [Cash] gave me the assurance. I told the house about it yesterday, that she had not disclosed the matter to journalists before the raid," he repeated once more.

"And that was the assurance that she gave me. Subsequently, as honourable members know, her media adviser admitted of his wrongful conduct and he has resigned."

Next, Shorten himself.

"Even now the position of the government is that staff can mislead their Ministers. How are your Ministers meant to be running the country when they can't even run their offers?" he said.

Shorten: How are your ministers meant to be running the country when they can't even run their office? #qt â€” Luke Henriques-Gomes (@lukehgomes) October 26, 2017

This was the main event of the question time match and the Prime Minister had come prepared.

"The honourable Member knows very well that the Minister [Cash] is accountable. A Minister is accountable for what she says and her obligation is to speak the truth," he said.

"She was misled, as she said. And once her staffer told her the truth and made the admission that he had done the wrong thing, she corrected the record. She acted entirely properly.

"That stands in stark contrast to the actions of the Leader of the Opposition, Mr Speaker... It is not a question of his staff. It is a question of the people that own him. He is a wholly owned subsidiary of the CFMEU. He is a wholly owned subsidiary of a trade union -- a military trade union, cashed up and powerful -- that defies the law."

Prime Minister Malcolm Turnbull during question time at Parliament House in Canberra on Thursday 26 October 2017. Fedpol. Photo: Andrew Meares

It wasn't done there. Burke rose twice more in between separate questions on unions and the AFP to send yet another shot towards Turnbull. The Opposition Member called once again for Cash to be sacked and then requested a motion be passed, which later failed.

"The Minister for Employment, senator Cash, gave evidence in the course of estimates in which she described the facts of the matter as known to her at the time," Turnbull closed.

"When a staffer admitted to doing the wrong thing, she corrected the record in light of that admission. That is precisely what she should have done."

After being forced to play so much defence on the final day of the sitting week, Turnbull will no doubt welcome a fortnight off to try and bury the narrative under literally anything else.
TITLE: Malcolm Turnbull Peppered With Questions In Parliament Over Michaelia Cash Controversy

SUMMARY:
One of the advantages of the hot mess that 2017 has been, 10 months in, is that there's plenty of fodder for last-minute Halloween costumes.
Some of the 20 last-minute DIY costumes below are best done as a solo affair, while others work well as couples or group costumes â€” use your imagination!
A few of them are a little dark, a lot of them are funny, but all of them will be perfectly at home at a 2017 Halloween party.
BoJack HorsemanA post shared by ilduca_acudli (@ilduca_acudli) on Oct 20, 2017 at 5:59am PDTEveryone's favourite terrible-yet-compelling animated B-list horse!
Fidget spinnerHow to make a fidget spinner Halloween costume: https://t.co/KzHYghTd6l pic.twitter.com/Rrf76qAiBS â€” Lifehacker (@lifehacker) September 27, 2017The trendiest toy of 2017 may be fading from popularity, but it's still a great costume idea.
TEXT:
One of the advantages of the hot mess that 2017 has been, 10 months in, is that there's plenty of fodder for last-minute Halloween costumes.

And fortunately, most of these costumes are relatively easy to DIY with what you already have at home and/or a quick trip to the dollar or thrift store. You don't even necessarily need glue to put these together â€” just some creativity will do.

Some of the 20 last-minute DIY costumes below are best done as a solo affair, while others work well as couples or group costumes â€” use your imagination! A few of them are a little dark, a lot of them are funny, but all of them will be perfectly at home at a 2017 Halloween party.

BoJack Horseman

A post shared by ilduca_acudli (@ilduca_acudli) on Oct 20, 2017 at 5:59am PDT

Everyone's favourite terrible-yet-compelling animated B-list horse! If you can get your hands on one of those creepy horse masks, you just need a terrible sweater and the air of defeat, but it'd be even better with a printed-out illustrated BoJack head.

Fake news

People are saying it's everywhere! Well, one particular person, anyway. Make yourself an outfit out of newspapers (they're still a thing!) and stamp a big red FAKE all over it. Much more creative than the "sexy" version that was of course released this year.

'90s resurrection

A post shared by Elizabeth Keene (@elizabethkeene) on Oct 19, 2017 at 5:25pm PDT

Put all those discounted crop tops and platform slides at the mall to good use and go as your most coveted teenage outfit from the Delia's catalogue.

Avocado toast

A post shared by Brit + Co (@britandco) on Oct 13, 2017 at 3:39pm PDT

If avocado toast is going to bring us all down eventually, we might as well celebrate the food that's allegedly preventing you from ever owning a home. This costume is made with fabric but you can do it even more easily with cardboard and coloured paper.

Millennial pink

A post shared by Oh Happy Day (@ohhappyday) on Oct 14, 2017 at 11:16am PDT

Go as the colour of the moment by adorning yourself with millennial pink from head to toe. We bet you already have a bunch of the pieces in your closet. Don't forget lips, nails â€” even hair!

Your favourite emoji

A post shared by Kevin (@fashionelevatorshoes) on Oct 25, 2016 at 12:57am PDT

OK, so the movie wasn't great â€” but emojis are still a lot of fun. It's easy to go as your favourite for Halloween with a costume made from bristol board, thin foam and paint, or even felt and a brightly coloured t-shirt.

Multiple Taylor Swifts

Get some inspiration from Swift's "Look What You Made Me Do" music video for your group costume and go as the various Taylor incarnations: "bad" Swift, zombie Swift, etc.

Fidget spinner

How to make a fidget spinner Halloween costume: https://t.co/KzHYghTd6l pic.twitter.com/Rrf76qAiBS â€” Lifehacker (@lifehacker) September 27, 2017

The trendiest toy of 2017 may be fading from popularity, but it's still a great costume idea. Just get some cardboard â€” bonus points if you can figure out how to really make it move.

Eleven from "Stranger Things"

Photo documentation of all the outfits and junk food! ^^ #elevencosplay #eleven #strangerthingscosplay #strangerthings #netflix @netflixstrangerthings @strangerthingsfanatics A post shared by Mary & Feinobi cosplay (@maryandfeinobi) on Jul 10, 2017 at 10:46am PDT

Dig that box of Eggos out of your freezer and celebrate the return of "Stranger Things." If you're really on the ball, binge the new episodes and go as season 2 Eleven.

BBC interview girl

A post shared by Guardian Australia (@guardianaustralia) on Mar 12, 2017 at 2:27pm PDT

She swaggered her way into our hearts earlier this year, and "BBC Interview Girl" â€” complete with yellow sweater, glasses and pigtails â€” would be welcome to interrupt any Halloween party.

Dart Guy

I would do my face paint and dress up like "Dart Guy". Would love to go to the game with @dpurch79 @googz88 and @VidaGlam #fansgofurther pic.twitter.com/MZO9ZWStbI â€” The Guggemeister (@googz80) October 23, 2017

Already have a Leafs jersey hanging in your closet? Then you're well on your way to going as "Dart Guy," everyone's favourite Leafs fan. Just stick to fake cigarettes, OK?

Vacation Obama

Started wearing less and going out more. pic.twitter.com/0FLoF9vZwX â€” Blue Shakalaka (@BeezHunny) February 7, 2017

Wouldn't you be smiling too if you'd had a tropical getaway? Throw on a helmet and a sleek life vest, pull out those wraparound shades, and start smiling.

This Is The Future That Liberals Want meme

this is the future liberals want pic.twitter.com/26wWUKfLCg â€” darth:â„¢ (@darth) March 2, 2017

There are endless variations here thanks to the popularity of the meme, but we are personally fans of this version of "This Is The Future That Liberals Want." Recreate it with a bunch of plush dogs â€” or just photos â€” attached to every spare surface of your clothing.

Babadook loves Pennywise

The Babadook and Pennywise are the next big horror couple...



But who wears the better threads? ğŸ¤” pic.twitter.com/QfSUMyQIzl â€” Antifreeze ğŸ‡ (@AntiBunbun) September 12, 2017

Many have referred to Halloween as "Gay Christmas" but why not bring in a bit of Valentine's-style romance? We are referring, of course, to the LGBTQ couple of the year: Babadook and Pennywise. Get out the clown makeup, start constructing a giant Babadook made of fabric, and have fun.

Dancing Snapchat hot dog

I'm the Snapchat hot dog & Madam is an astronaut. pic.twitter.com/8XaIdHh3IQ â€” Alexandra Benson (@alexandraeryn) October 22, 2017

Get a red T-shirt and pants, a brown vest, put on headphones, and add some squiggles of green and yellow. Now put on some music and you're not just a hot dog â€” you're the dancing Snapchat hot dog!

The ladies of "â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹GLOW"

A post shared by Janie Brookshire (@brookshirejane) on Jun 27, 2017 at 6:16pm PDT

Get your best friends together and celebrate "GLOW," the Netflix hit that provides plenty of great uber-'80s Halloween ideas.

Solar eclipse

A post shared by Abhinav Sharma (@thebackstorybyabhinav) on Oct 20, 2017 at 3:47am PDT

That was a nice distraction from regular news for a bit, huh? Bring the eclipse black with an all-black outfit accented by a sliver of gold or yellow â€” a bow, a single glove, you choose.

A handmaid from The Handmaid's Tale

This may fall under the category of "too soon" but it could also be seen as combining costume and protest. Make the hat with white bristol board, pair it with a dark red dress, and get some friends in on the action.

Ivanka's neighbour

Aesthetic goals: Ivanka Trump's neighbor sipping wine in a fur coat as a protest goes down ğŸ’…ğŸ¼ğŸ³ï¸â€ğŸŒˆ pic.twitter.com/osvamoECkj â€” Cá´É´á´Ê€ AÊ€á´˜á´¡á´‡ÊŸ ğŸŒ¹ (@Arpwel) April 3, 2017

Ivanka Trump's D.C. neighbour â€” who was spotted enjoying a protest in a fur, with wine in hand â€” broke the internet last spring. Bring her aesthetic back with a big fake fur from the thrift store, a glass of vino, and a big smile.

Vacation Mario

Is this a first for Mario? Mario letting them nipples fly free? What a time to be alive. pic.twitter.com/zqlEFfpouY â€” GoNintendoTweet (@GoNintendoTweet) September 13, 2017

One of the most shocking news items of 2017? Mario has nipples. Pay homage to what looks like his great vacation with red shorts, a full mustache, that signature hat â€” and not much else.

Also on HuffPost:
TITLE: Last-Minute Halloween Costumes You Can Easily DIY

Aber Details Ã¼ber die sexuelle Vergangenheit des anderen zu erfahren, hat Vor- und Nachteile

Experten erklÃ¤ren, wie ihr das GesprÃ¤ch am besten angeht und ob es gut fÃ¼r die Beziehung ist

Der Beginn einer neuen Beziehung ist eine Zeit des gegenseitigen Entdeckens. Eine Zeit, in der so manches ans Licht kommt, das du Ã¼ber den neuen Menschen in deinem Leben wissen musst â€“ Positives wie Negatives. Und mitunter sind das auch Ã¤uÃŸerst unschÃ¶ne Dinge.

Doch wie viel wollen wir denn in Bezug auf Sex wirklich wissen? Also genauer gesagt: Wollen wir wirklich ganz genau wissen, mit wie vielen Leuten der andere schon geschlafen hat?

Und wird man eher miteinander glÃ¼cklich werden, wenn man diese Information mit seinem Partner teilt oder wenn man es lieber sein lÃ¤sst?

â€œEs ist voll und ganz dir selbst Ã¼berlassen, ob du mit deinem Partner darÃ¼ber sprechen mÃ¶chtest oder nichtâ€, sagt Peter Saddington, Berater bei der britischen Paarberatungsorganisation "Relate". â€œDas hÃ¤ngt wohl grÃ¶ÃŸtenteils davon ab, wie viel du Anderen im Allgemeinen Ã¼ber dich verrÃ¤tst.â€

Wie viel jemand seinem Partner anvertraue, hÃ¤nge von mehreren Faktoren ab, glaubt er - beispielsweise von kultureller Abstammung oder ReligionszugehÃ¶rigkeit. "AuÃŸerdem kÃ¶nnte es eine Rolle spielen, wie sicher du dich in deiner Beziehung fÃ¼hlst und was du selbst Ã¼ber deine sexuelle Vergangenheit denkstâ€, sagt Saddington.

Deshalb haben wir Beziehungsexperten gefragt, welche Vorteile oder mÃ¶glichen Probleme es mit sich bringen kÃ¶nnte, wenn man sich dafÃ¼r entscheidet, seine sexuelle Vergangenheit offenzulegen.

Was sind die Vorteile, wenn du mit deinem Partner Ã¼ber deine sexuelle Vergangenheit sprichst?

1. Du musst keine Energie mehr darauf verwenden, deine Vergangenheit geheim zu halten

Wenn du es gewohnt bist, mit deinem Partner auch offen Ã¼ber intime Aspekte deines Lebens zu sprechen, kÃ¶nnte es dich emotional sehr viel Kraft kosten, genau diese eine persÃ¶nliche Information fÃ¼r dich zu behalten.

Sarah Ryan, Beziehungsexpertin und Inhaberin einer Partnervermittlung, ist der Meinung, es kann die Beziehung weiterbringen, wenn du dich deinem Partner gegenÃ¼ber Ã¶ffnest.

â€œEine dauerhaft stabile Beziehung beruht immer auf zwei grundsÃ¤tzlichen Elementen, nÃ¤mlich auf Vertrauen und Respekt", sagt sie. "Ich finde, dass man seinem Partner deshalb so viel wie mÃ¶glich anvertrauen sollte. Und dazu gehÃ¶rt auch die eigene sexuelle Vergangenheit."

Und sie sagt auch: â€œWenn du mit einem Menschen zusammen bist, mit dem du dein Leben verbringen willst, warum solltest du ihm dann nichts von deinen Expartnern und von deinen frÃ¼heren Erfahrungen erzÃ¤hlen?â€

Bestimmte Dinge zu verschweigen koste meist mehr Kraft, als sich jemandem anzuvertrauen und die Vergangenheit ruhen zu lassen.

2. Deine frÃ¼heren Erfahrungen haben dich zu dem Menschen gemacht, der du heute bist

Es besteht kein Zweifel, dass deine frÃ¼heren Liebesbeziehungen und deine sexuellen Erfahrungen dich in deiner PersÃ¶nlichkeit und in deinem heutigen Verhalten in Beziehungen zumindest teilweise geprÃ¤gt haben.

Deshalb kÃ¶nnten diese Dinge deinem Partner wichtige Hintergrundinformationen liefern, um dich besser verstehen zu kÃ¶nnen.

â€œDeine frÃ¼heren Erfahrungen entscheiden zwar nicht Ã¼ber deine Zukunft, doch sie haben dich definitiv zu dem Menschen gemacht, der du heute bist", sagt Ryan. "Sicherlich will dein Partner so viel wie mÃ¶glich Ã¼ber dich wissen. Und dazu gehÃ¶rt auch, dass du mit ihm Ã¼ber deine frÃ¼heren Sexpartner sprichst. Das ist besonders wichtig, wenn es sich um eine ernsthafte Beziehung handelt."

â¨ Mehr zum Thema: Experten raten: Auf diese 8 unterschÃ¤tzten Eigenschaften solltet ihr bei der Partnerwahl achten

3. In Beziehungen sollte man immer ehrlich sein



Es mag vielleicht nach einem Klischee klingen, doch Ehrlichkeit ist meist der beste Weg in einer Beziehung. Und obwohl es nicht automatisch bedeutet, dass du deinen Partner anlÃ¼gst, wenn du ihm nicht alles erzÃ¤hlst, wirst du bemerken, dass du frÃ¼her oder spÃ¤ter kleine NotlÃ¼gen erfinden musst. WÃ¤re es denn dann nicht einfacher, wenn er Bescheid wÃ¼sste?

â€œMeiner Meinung nach sollte man in Beziehungen immer ehrlich sein. Man sollte fÃ¼r seinen Partner in so vielen Bereichen wie nur irgendwie mÃ¶glich ein offenes Buch seinâ€, sagt Ryan.

Was sind die Nachteile, wenn du mit deinem Partner Ã¼ber deine sexuelle Vergangenheit sprichst?

1. Euer gegenseitiges Bild voneinander kÃ¶nnte sich verÃ¤ndern

Wie wir alle wissen, sollte die Anzahl der Leute, mit denen dein Partner schon geschlafen hat, keinen Einfluss auf eure aktuelle Beziehung haben â€“ schlieÃŸlich ist das alles lÃ¤ngst Geschichte.

Du solltest dir jedoch gut Ã¼berlegen, wie du denn eigentlich selbst zu Gelegenheitssex, zu sexueller FreizÃ¼gigkeit oder zu mangelnder sexueller Offenheit stehst, bevor du nach weiteren Informationen forschst.

â€œWenn du deinen Partner fragst, mit wie vielen Leuten er schon geschlafen hat, und er es dir sagt, solltest du versuchen, ihn nicht dafÃ¼r zu verurteilenâ€, rÃ¤t Saddington. â€œDenn du wolltest es ja unbedingt wissen.â€

Wenn jemand es aber nicht erzÃ¤hlen wolle, kÃ¶nne man ihn durchaus nach dem Grund dafÃ¼r fragen. "Du solltest ihn allerdings nicht bedrÃ¤ngen und seine PrivatsphÃ¤re respektieren, wenn er nicht mit dir darÃ¼ber sprechen mÃ¶chte."

â€œWenn dein Partner dich dafÃ¼r verurteilt, mit wie vielen Leuten du schon geschlafen hast, solltest du daran denken, dass dies sehr viel mehr Ã¼ber ihn selbst und Ã¼ber seine eigenen Unsicherheiten und Vorurteile aussagt, als Ã¼ber dich.â€

2. Dir kÃ¶nnte bewusst werden, dass dein Partner kontrollsÃ¼chtig ist

Wenn du darÃ¼ber nachdenkst, deinem Partner von deinen frÃ¼heren Sexpartnern zu erzÃ¤hlen, solltest du nicht vergessen, dass du ihm diese Information nicht schuldest und dass du durchaus das Recht hast, darÃ¼ber zu schweigen.

Wenn dein Partner dich ganz nebenbei danach fragt, musst du dir keine Sorgen machen. Wenn er jedoch versucht, ein GestÃ¤ndnis aus dir herauszupressen, solltest du dir Ã¼ber seine Motivation Gedanken machen.

â€œEs ist es wert, dich selbst oder sogar deinen Partner direkt zu fragen, warum er diese Information eigentlich haben willâ€, sagt Saddington.

â€œDu wirst es instinktiv spÃ¼ren, wenn diese Frage aus dem Mund deines Partners aufdringlich oder unangenehm rÃ¼berkommt. Wenn dein Partner versucht, dich zu einer Aussage zu drÃ¤ngen, kÃ¶nnte es ein Anzeichen dafÃ¼r sein, dass du in einer Kontrollbeziehung steckst.â€

Denn: â€œGesunde Beziehungen zeichnen sich dadurch aus, dass du das GefÃ¼hl hast, deinem Partner alles erzÃ¤hlen zu kÃ¶nnen, dass jedoch auch weiÃŸt, dass du das nicht tun musst.â€

â¨ Mehr zum Thema: Wenn die Liebe zur Qual wird: 10 Anzeichen, dass du in einer ungesunden Beziehung steckst

3. Es bringt nichts, deinem Partner einfach irgendeine beliebige Zahl zu nennen

Letzten Endes ist eine Zahl einfach nur eine Zahl. Du solltest dich also nicht zu sehr mit diesem willkÃ¼rlichen Beweis deiner 'sexuellen Erfahrenheit' herumplagen.

Denn wie wir alle wissen, sagt die Zahl der Kerben in der Bettkante Ã¼berhaupt nichts darÃ¼ber aus, ob jemand ein guter Liebhaber ist.

â€œEs wird vermutlich nicht besonders viel bringen, wenn du deinem Partner ganz genau sagst, mit wie vielen Leuten du schon geschlafen hast â€“ es sei denn, er will es unbedingt wissenâ€, sagt Ryan.

Es komme immer auf den Kontext an und dass man genau versteh, warum der Andere diese Information denn eigentlich Ã¼berhaupt haben wolle.

â€œWenn es darum geht, dass ihr beide herausfinden wollt, worauf ihr beim Sex steht, dann ist diese Information wichtig fÃ¼r eure kÃ¶rperliche Kommunikation im Bett. Wenn ihr jedoch lediglich wissen wollt, wer von euch beiden 'sexuell erfahrener' ist, bringt euch dieses GesprÃ¤ch Ã¼berhaupt nichts fÃ¼r eure Beziehung.â€

Wie solltest du dieses GesprÃ¤ch angehen?

Wenn du dich dazu entschlossen hast, mit deinem Partner Ã¼ber deine sexuelle Vergangenheit zu sprechen, solltest du dir genau Ã¼berlegen, wie du das GesprÃ¤ch am besten angehst.

Bevor du mit ihm Ã¼ber dieses Thema sprichst, solltet ihr erst einmal abklÃ¤ren, ob ihr es denn gegenseitig Ã¼berhaupt wissen wollt. Es kÃ¶nnte sich sonst so anfÃ¼hlen, als hÃ¤ttest du zu schnell die Karten auf den Tisch gelegt.

Frag dich selbst, wie wichtig dir diese Zahl denn Ã¼berhaupt ist und wie es dir wohl gehen wÃ¼rde, wenn deine Zahl hÃ¶her oder niedriger wÃ¤re als die deines Partners? WÃ¼rdest du es dann vielleicht lieber doch nicht wissen wollen?

DarÃ¼ber hinaus solltest du dir Ã¼berlegen, welche Informationen deinen Partner Ã¼berhaupt etwas angehen: â€œIm Detail darÃ¼ber zu sprechen, mit wem du wo und wann Sex in welchen Positionen hattest, und wie groÃŸ bestimmte KÃ¶rperteile deiner Partner jeweils waren, dÃ¼rfte nicht besonders hilfreich seinâ€, rÃ¤t Saddington.

â¨ Mehr zum Thema: Wenn zwei Menschen fÃ¼reinander bestimmt sind, werden sie auch zueinander finden

AuÃŸerdem solltest du dir Ã¼ber die PrivatsphÃ¤re der Leute, mit denen du geschlafen hast, Gedanken machen. Wie wÃ¼rdest du dich fÃ¼hlen, wenn jemand mit seinem neuen Partner Ã¼ber dich herzieht?

Dieser Artikel erschien ursprÃ¼nglich bei der HuffPost UK und wurde von Susanne Raupach aus dem Englischen Ã¼bersetzt.
